title: TuneGenius: The Stock Market for Music.
body:
**Mission:** Discover the true intrinsic value of a music.

TuneGenius is a P2P music streaming platform built for Web3. Users can follow artists, create playlists, and do all of the same activities built into todays legacy services but on TuneGeniusâ€¦ there is a little extra sauce. Users can now own NFTs from their favorite artists representing a % ownership in the songs of their choice, and have those royalties distributed passively into their wallet. These NFTs will open access to the artists intimate investor community, and give them chances to win prizes and unlock the artists ability to give back WAY more to their loyal fans. In the traditional stock market, retail investors can own shares in a company and receive dividends for their participation; this is similar and why we are calling TuneGenius â€œthe stock market for music.â€

Music is one of the most valuable assets humans have and will hold value thousands of years into the future, and millionaires will be made investing in up & coming talent just simply by finding them early in their career and owning a % of their first hit song. Artists like Kanye West, Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash, ect. will have songs played potentially 10,000 years from now, and keeping that value in your family tree is now possible with ownership locked into a smart contract on the Ethereum Blockchain.

NFTs have gotten a bad reputation from Bored Ape profile pictures, numerous scams and 99% losses, but the truth is all an NFT represents is immutable digital ownership, and humans have only scratched the surface of what this can mean for our society. Although the use cases for NFTs are nearly endless, TuneGenius is choosing to block out the noise and focus 100% on improving music and how we can associate fair market value to that music. Currently, streaming services use 1 numerical value per listen ($0.004/stream on average) even though the circumstances in which each person consumes a song is entirely different, and this method makes up over 80% of the total yearly revenue in the music industry.

Historically, we would have paid $20 for our favorite album on the first dayâ€¦ now that first listen of your artists new 10 song album on the first day only raises roughly $0.04 for the artist. So, where did all this value go? Napster came along and gave us free music and disrupted consumers sense of value for the music they love, but it was still there, we just had no way to capture itâ€¦ until TuneGenius!

Defining a fine line in which consumers will happily pay before resorting to pirating the song is difficult, we chose $0.025 USDC/stream which is 6x+ more then the current standard. This is subject to change by the TuneGeniusDAO which will be ran by the artists and fans on the platform, who will constantly be in search of the perfect equilibrium on this number. At least now investors can see a tangible number which can result in a large R.O.I. if a song reaches millions of people on TuneGenius.

These ownership NFTs are more powerful than you may thinkâ€¦ imagine auctioning off the % royalties of your new song in a format where everyone can participate. Justin Rogers is the founder of TuneGenius and comes from a lifetime of experience in the auction industry; he was an Auctioneer long before he was a rapper! This experience allows useful insight into this relationship and has allowed him to create a new auction method in which true market value can be derived while also allowing all fans to participate. This process is called the TuneRaise. An artist will put a % of their royalties up for â€œTuneRaiseâ€ and each fan can allocate as much as they choose. 1 fan may choose $5, 1 fan may choose $5000, when the event is over each participant receives an NFT representing % ownership in the song proportionate to the amount they put in. Artists can also choose to associate ownership with tiers, and if your NFT is in a certain % bracket, it opens you up to more possibilities. (Higher % chance of winning prizes, Special Merch & Experiences, ect.)

Come & Join our mission in building the stock market for music here â†’ 

[https://t.co/hlFuZjV0eH](https://t.co/hlFuZjV0eH)

title: .earth | a faster way to explore web3
body:
The current experience for users of web3 systems relies on a complex knowledge of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. .earth intends to simplify the user experience.

### the problem: on-chain data is complex

Early adopters of decentralized networks were required to have a layered understanding of blockchain mechanics, language, networks, and applications. While everyone is doing cool things like sending and receiving tokenized assets, participating in the governance of their favorite organizations, and staking assets to earn rewards, most of these actions are difficult to see at once, and require using multiple dapps.

![WEB3 NAVIGATION IS FRAGMENTED](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c0hP1XQ-uwYf-Pvo0Pq4g.png?height=912&width=1884)

A majority of the experience involves reading granular information to inspect transaction details, verify contracts, or track wallet activity, while being overwhelmed by a multitude of different data variables being presented.

![ON-CHAIN DATA IS COMPLEX](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XuN_Y_2JLquXH0COm1rSs.png?height=614&width=1672)

Understanding what has happened on-chain is not only difficult but also time-consuming, for even the most experienced users. This is our biggest barrier to driving mass adoption and expanding utility for future users. As the web3 ecosystem grows we need to re-think how we communicate and interpret block interactions to onboard new users and achieve greater scale. Itâ€™s all about learning with each other in web3, and weâ€™re making that easier.

## our mission: changing the game of block exploration

.earth is changing the face of block exploration. Weâ€™re in the business of translating complex transactions on cryptocurrency networks, so you can easily show off and find all the cool stuff that happens on chain.

Instead of looking up a transaction for a 50/50 FTX/ETH LP pair on Uniswap using Etherscanâ€¦

![ETHERSCAN SCREENSHOT OF UNISWAP LP ADD](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oGP2gJugh0-y2RNvaZPy-.png?height=543&width=886)

Imagine being presented this image of an LP pool.

![.EARTH GLYPH OF A UNISWAP LP POOL ADD](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JYfIhTZEg4C_dlGoKu_Yi.png?height=586&width=698)

## weâ€™re creating a beautiful visual language that simplifies TXN information

.earth is focused on delivering an experience driven by an easy to understand visual language that is built for mass adoption. Weâ€™re **literally building the language of web3, with high fidelity glyphs** of everyday on-chain interactions. Working with the finest graphic and visual designers, data scientists and smart contract developers, weâ€™re bringing you the beautiful, seamless web3 experience we all deserve. Our visual language will set the stage for global recognition of everything web3. Our graphic symbology will quite literally represent the blockchain.

## what we do

Someone just bought an Ape Punk and joined the CryptoPunks community. Check out who they are and what theyâ€™ve been doing on Mainnet last week with just a few clicks. Who you are in web3 is first and foremost about what you do on-chain. We make it easy for you to look up users, trends, tokens, events and other activities, so you spend **far less time** being **much more** informed.

![WHAT WE DO](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wdZ04q_u6gOoA9QdEDigU.png?height=628&width=1812)

Our .earth maps aim to define, capture and share moments and personas as they are happening in real-time. Use our maps to create stories and gather valuable insights on most recent user activity, group behaviors, key trends and major events all within the same visual language.

![HOW IT WORKS](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TMP-THlBxfPRcBenB2hio.png?height=906&width=1898)

Participate in the next iteration of web3 exploration. Weâ€™re going visual and viral. Come discover web3 and tell your story with .earth.

title: .earth | a faster way to explore web3
body:
The current experience for users of web3 systems relies on a complex knowledge of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. .earth intends to simplify the user experience.

### the problem: on-chain data is complex

Early adopters of decentralized networks were required to have a layered understanding of blockchain mechanics, language, networks, and applications. While everyone is doing cool things like sending and receiving tokenized assets, participating in the governance of their favorite organizations, and staking assets to earn rewards, most of these actions are difficult to see at once, and require using multiple dapps.

![WEB3 NAVIGATION IS FRAGMENTED](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c0hP1XQ-uwYf-Pvo0Pq4g.png?height=912&width=1884)

A majority of the experience involves reading granular information to inspect transaction details, verify contracts, or track wallet activity, while being overwhelmed by a multitude of different data variables being presented.

![ON-CHAIN DATA IS COMPLEX](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XuN_Y_2JLquXH0COm1rSs.png?height=614&width=1672)

Understanding what has happened on-chain is not only difficult but also time-consuming, for even the most experienced users. This is our biggest barrier to driving mass adoption and expanding utility for future users. As the web3 ecosystem grows we need to re-think how we communicate and interpret block interactions to onboard new users and achieve greater scale. Itâ€™s all about learning with each other in web3, and weâ€™re making that easier.

## our mission: changing the face of block exploration

.earth is changing the face of block exploration. Weâ€™re in the business of translating complex transactions on cryptocurrency networks, so you can easily show off and find all the cool stuff that happens on chain.

Instead of looking up a transaction for a 50/50 FTX/ETH LP pair on Uniswap using Etherscanâ€¦

![ETHERSCAN SCREENSHOT OF UNISWAP LP ADD](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oGP2gJugh0-y2RNvaZPy-.png?height=543&width=886)

Imagine being presented this image of an LP pool.

![.EARTH GLYPH OF A UNISWAP LP POOL ADD](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JYfIhTZEg4C_dlGoKu_Yi.png?height=586&width=698)

## weâ€™re creating a beautiful visual language that simplifies TXN information

.earth is focused on delivering an experience driven by an easy to understand visual language that is built for mass adoption. Weâ€™re **literally building the language of web3, with high fidelity glyphs** of everyday on-chain interactions. Working with the finest graphic and visual designers, data scientists and smart contract developers, weâ€™re bringing you the beautiful, seamless web3 experience we all deserve. Our visual language will set the stage for global recognition of everything web3. Our graphic symbology will quite literally represent the blockchain.

## what we do

Someone just bought an Ape Punk and joined the CryptoPunks community. Check out who they are and what theyâ€™ve been doing on Mainnet last week with just a few clicks. Who you are in web3 is first and foremost about what you do on-chain. We make it easy for you to look up users, trends, tokens, events and other activities, so you spend **far less time** being **much more** informed.

![WHAT WE DO](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wdZ04q_u6gOoA9QdEDigU.png?height=628&width=1812)

Our .earth maps aim to define, capture and share moments and personas as they are happening in real-time. Use our maps to create stories and gather valuable insights on most recent user activity, group behaviors, key trends and major events all within the same visual language.

![HOW IT WORKS](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TMP-THlBxfPRcBenB2hio.png?height=906&width=1898)

Participate in the next iteration of web3 exploration. Weâ€™re going visual and viral. Come discover web3 and tell your story with .earth.

* Pragmatic Play

Apabila kalian memiliki modal yang kecil dan ingin mendapatkan jackpot besar secara mudah, maka slot online merupakan pilihan yang tepat. Kalian hanya harus mengubah arah permainannya dengan menekan tombol â€œspinâ€ kemudian menunggu hingga sistem mencocokkan line dalam simbol yang sama.

### Bola Online

Di antaranya ada baccarat, dragon tier, roulette, sic bo, dan black jack. Semua jenis permainan tersebut di dukung dengan grafik yang bagus serta sistem permainan yang fair dari masing-masing provider tanpa adanya campur tangan dari pihak kami.

Sebagai jenis permainan judi favorit masyarakat Indonesia, maka kami hadirkan provider populer yakni IDN Poker, Balak Play, dan 1 Gaming.

Kalian bisa memanfaatkan beragam jenis permainan poker yang terdapat di situs judi online kami untuk bermain bersama teman-teman, saudara, atau bahkan pesaing kalian di meja yang sama.

### Tembak Ikan

Apabila kalian pernah main game arcade, tentu pernah menjumpai permainan tembak ikan bukan? Game ini termasuk game yang biasa dimainkan secara bersama-sama dengan 4 â€“ 8 orang untuk menembak ikan atau monster laut.

## FAQ Terkait Layanan UNTUNG88

Berikut beberapa pertanyaan yang sering diajukan oleh para pengguna maupun para calon pelanggan kami:

### (Q1). Bagaimana cara bukan akun member di UNTUNG88?

Jawab: untuk membuat akun member di UNTUNG88 sangatlah mudah, kalain cukup ikuti langkah-langkah berikut ini:

1. Masuk ke homepage situs resmi UNTUNG88.
2. Klik tombol â€œDaftarâ€ di pojok kanan atas.
3. Isilah kolom yang dibutuhkan dengan data yang benar.

\###(Q2). Apakah UNTUNG88 merupakan situs tepercaya?

Jawab: situs kami merupakan situs terpercaya yang telah beroperasi selama bertahun-tahun dalam melayani permainan judi dari Indonesia dan Asia.

\###(Q3). Bagaimana cara deposit ke akun UNTUNG88 milik saya?

### (Q4). Apa sajakah mata uang yang didukung oleh UNTUNG88?

Jawab: Saat ini, mata uang yang diterima oleh UNTUNG88 ialah mata uang Rupiah (IDR) dengan perhitungan berbasis poin IDR dengan ketentuan:

1 poin IDR = Rp 1.000

### (Q5).  Apakah ada batas taruhan minimal dalam betting?

Jawab: Tiap jenis permainan yang disediakan di UNTUNG88 memiliki batas taruhan minimal yang perlu kalian pertaruhkan.

Batas permainan ini tidak bisa diubah karena sudah keputusan pihak UNTUNG88 serta pihak provider penyedia layanan. Kalian akan diberi informasi terkait hal ini saat pertama kali masuk permainan.

title: Link Alternatif Login UNTUNG88 Terbaru
body:
Saat ini, alamat website [untung88.com](http://untung88.com), [untung88.info](http://untung88.info), dan [untung88.net](http://untung88.net) telah diblokir di Indonesia sehingga menyebabkan para pengguna dan pemain gagal dalam mengakses situs. ### Casino Online

Ada banyak sekali variasi permainan casino yang terdapat di UNTUNG88. Sebagai salah satu situs permainan casino terlengkap, tentu permainan yang dihadirkan pun termasuk permainan yang banyak dimainkan masyarakat Indonesia.

### Tembak Ikan

Apabila kalian pernah main game arcade, tentu pernah menjumpai permainan tembak ikan bukan? Game ini termasuk game yang biasa dimainkan secara bersama-sama dengan 4 â€“ 8 orang untuk menembak ikan atau monster laut.

## FAQ Terkait Layanan UNTUNG88

Berikut beberapa pertanyaan yang sering diajukan oleh para pengguna maupun para calon pelanggan kami:

### (Q1). Bagaimana cara bukan akun member di UNTUNG88?

Jawab: untuk membuat akun member di UNTUNG88 sangatlah mudah, kalain cukup ikuti langkah-langkah berikut ini:

1. Masuk ke homepage situs resmi UNTUNG88.
2. Klik tombol â€œDaftarâ€ di pojok kanan atas.
3. Isilah kolom yang dibutuhkan dengan data yang benar.
4. Konfirmasi bahwa kalian telah berusia 18 tahun.
5. Klik Daftar lalu silakan masuk dengan data login yang dibuat.

\###(Q2). Apakah UNTUNG88 merupakan situs tepercaya?

Jawab: situs kami merupakan situs terpercaya yang telah beroperasi selama bertahun-tahun dalam melayani permainan judi dari Indonesia dan Asia.

Lokasi kantor kami berada di Manila, Filipina dan mendapatkan lisensi PACGOR yang membuktikan bahwa kami merupakan layanan tepercaya yang seluruh data transaksi keuangan kalian menjadi privasi yang kami jaga serta kemenangan member yang pasti dibayar.

\###(Q3). Bagaimana cara deposit ke akun UNTUNG88 milik saya?

Jawab: untuk bisa bermain berbagai macam layanan yang kami miliki, kalian harus melakukan deposit terlebih ke dahulu ke akun kalian menggunakan sistem deposit:

* Online deposit
* Bank lokal: BCA, BNI, BRI, MANDIRI, CIMB NIAGA dan DANAMON

### (Q4). Apa sajakah mata uang yang didukung oleh UNTUNG88?

Jawab: Saat ini, mata uang yang diterima oleh UNTUNG88 ialah mata uang Rupiah (IDR) dengan perhitungan berbasis poin IDR dengan ketentuan:

1 poin IDR = Rp 1.000

### (Q5).  Apakah ada batas taruhan minimal dalam betting?

Jawab: Tiap jenis permainan yang disediakan di UNTUNG88 memiliki batas taruhan minimal yang perlu kalian pertaruhkan.

Batas permainan ini tidak bisa diubah karena sudah keputusan pihak UNTUNG88 serta pihak provider penyedia layanan. Kalian akan diberi informasi terkait hal ini saat pertama kali masuk permainan.

title: Link Alternatif Login UNTUNG88 Terbaru
body:
Saat ini, alamat website [untung88.com](http://untung88.com), [untung88.info](http://untung88.info), dan [untung88.net](http://untung88.net) telah diblokir di Indonesia sehingga menyebabkan para pengguna dan pemain gagal dalam mengakses situs. Untuk mengaksesnya, kalian bisa mencoba melalui link alternatif terbaru UNTUNG88 yang akan kami perbarui ke alamat tautan baru.

[KLIK DISINI UNTUK DOWNLOAD APLIKASI ANDROID UNTUK MENGHINDARI NAWALA](https://apk-depot.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/utn.apk)

UNTUNG88 merupakan situs yang menawarkan layanan judi populer seperti slot online, poker, casino, capit duit, bola, tembak ikan, serta beragam permainan unik lainnya yang bisa dinikmati 24/7 secara bebas di manapun dan kapan pun juga.

Sebagai penyedia pusat judi online yang aman dan tepercaya, kalian bisa menikmati permainan tanpa takut lagi kehilangan uang. Bahkan, kami juga menyediakan layanan judi bola yang bisa diikuti oleh kalian yang ingin berpartisipasi dalam memeriahkan liga dan kejuaraan sepak boleh di seluruh dunia.

Jika kalian merupakan pemain yang tangguh dan penuh keberuntungan, maka buktikanlah untuk main di UNTUNG88. Dengan pelayanan customer service yang ramah dan server yang selalu uptime 24 jam tanpa adanya downtime tentu membuat kalian tak perlu khawatir lagi terhadap angka kemenangan setiap harinya. Jika kalian menang, pasti kami akan membayarnya walau berapapun itu besarnya.

## Beragam Layanan yang Tersedia di UNTUNG88

Bagi pecinta game judi online, tentu permainan yang mereka mainkan tidak terbatas pada satu atau dua jenis saja bukan? Semakin banyak variasi yang mereka mainkan justru makin menguntungkan. Karena itu, kami menyediakan beragam jenis layanan seperti berikut ini:

### Slot Online

Slot online merupakan permainan paling populer di Indonesia. alasannya simpel, selain mudah dimainkan, keuntungan yang dimainkan juga luar biasa. Tanpa perlu strategi khusus yang begitu rumit untuk memainkannya.

Oleh sebab itu, kami menyediakan beberapa jenis permainan slot dari provider ternama yang bisa kalian pilih. Di antaranya ialah:

* Pragmatic Play
* MicroGaming
* Habanero
* PG Soft
* Playtech
* Joker
* Dan lainnya

Dari semua penyedia layanan slot online di atas, tentu Pragmatic Play merupakan pilihan favorit orang Indonesia. Tak hanya pilihan permainannya yang banyak, namun juga win rate nya yang besar.

Apabila kalian memiliki modal yang kecil dan ingin mendapatkan jackpot besar secara mudah, maka slot online merupakan pilihan yang tepat. Kalian hanya harus mengubah arah permainannya dengan menekan tombol â€œspinâ€ kemudian menunggu hingga sistem mencocokkan line dalam simbol yang sama.

### Bola Online

UNTUNG88 termasuk salah satu penyedia layanan Sportsbook terbesar di Indonesia. Kami bekerja sama dengan beberapa provider bola online yang tepercaya yakni IBC dan SBOBET yang telah terkenal di seluruh penjuru dunia.

Selain piala dunia, UNTUNG88 juga sejak awal dipersiapkan khusus untuk gelar piala Raja Eropa yang diadakan dalam 4 tahun sekali. Kedua momen tersebut tentu sudah ditunggu-tunggu oleh para pecinta bola dari seluruh dunia, termasuk dari Indonesia.

Nah, jika kalian tidak ingin melewatkan kesempatan tersebut, maka kami sarankan untuk tidak hanya menontonnya saja. Namun jadikan itu sebagai peluang untuk mendukung tim kesayangan melalui taruhan dengan teman. Pasti akan menjadi pengalaman yang seru dan menyenangkan.

title: ROLE Club X AotuWorld NFT: Story-oriented co-creation Program to Commence soon
body:
**Hi, ROLE Clubâ€™s frens!**

** 
 **Today, we are excited to announce that we have made a partnership with **AotuWorld NFT, the first independent sale of NFT in the BiliBili ecosystem**.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/t9dAOHPqSSXgsSdOPrDnQ.png?height=668&width=1280)

**ROLE Club, as an IP co-creation and co-operation Web3 platform, aims to provide a more accessible and transparent means for IP creators and IP enthusiasts to communicate, discuss and brainstorm with each other to co-create more impressive IP stories.**

Under the partnership with AotuWorld NFT, we will together with each other to **launch a story-oriented co-creation program**, absolutely open for anyone who is passionate about brainstorming, writing and creating various story plots.

## HOW TO JOIN the Co-creation Program

"AotuVerse" tells the story of King, a teenager from the mining planet Dengru. In order to change the fate of the people in his hometown from being enslaved, and at the same time to find his sister who did not return from the Aotu tournament three years ago, he signed up for the Aotu tournament and set foot on his own way of fighting.

More specific details about characters will be updated in our Discord: [discord.gg/VYQmcYHnft](https://t.co/sXEydovTYv)

### Requirements to start the co-creation:

1. Set up a complete story framework and context, and set some basic features of each character (age, appearance, skills, etc.)
2. Recruit role players. Applicants shall explain their understanding of the role in a text description. (within 100 words)
3. Based on the framework of the original story, each person shall play a role. Set up a plot committee, mainly to discuss the plot on how to set, appear, develop, etc. After the discussion, set up a co-creation group on social media app, such as Discord.
4. Join and conduct the co-creation

*Tips:*

*Participants should guarantee the necessary creation time and content output, and can not be absent without reason to affect the plot direction and content output.*** 
 **

If you are crazy about our forthcoming co-creation program, **JOIN our Discord** to catch up with more detailed news!Â  ğŸ‘‰ [discord.gg/VYQmcYHnft](https://t.co/sXEydovTYv)

### ğŸ‘‡ Where to find more about ROLE Club:

Website: [roleclub.org/#/](https://t.co/NoytqBd56H)

Twitter: <https://twitter.com/Role_Club>

Discord: [discord.gg/VYQmcYHnft](https://t.co/sXEydovTYv)

title: The Chipofy USB-C cable with a built-in power display is selling for a new low on Prime Day
body:
All kinds of stuff are on sale when [Amazon Prime Day](https://www.theverge.com/23206084/amazon-prime-day-best-tech-deals-still-available-earbuds-tablets-smartwatches-smart-home-2022) lasts two whole days. Here are [some things we love](https://www.theverge.com/2022/7/13/23206798/sony-wf1000xm4-noise-canceling-true-wireless-earbuds-tws-prime-day-2022-deal-sale), some of [our favorites](https://www.theverge.com/23207203/amazon-prime-day-favorites-deals-pet-kitchen-home-car-tech), and even some [utter crap](https://www.theverge.com/2022/7/13/23207152/worst-amazon-prime-day-deals-2022). But one intriguing piece of tech thatâ€™s currently on a Lightning Deal is the [Chipofy 6.6-foot USB-C 100W charging cable, complete with a freakinâ€™ built-in display for power metering](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09KLYBS5H/?tag=theverge02-20). This nifty little tool is on sale for just $15.32, a savings of $10.67 (41 percent) off its regular $25.99 asking price. It outputs enough wattage to power and charge even some full-size laptops, but the best part is youâ€™ll know exactly how many watts are actually reaching your device. **[Read our hands-on impressions here](https://www.theverge.com/2022/1/28/22907150/usb-c-pd-cable-power-meter-100-watt-power-delivery)**.

### Chipofy USB-C cable with wattage display

* $15
* $26
* 42% off

This 6.6-foot USB-C to USB-C cable has a display that shows the wattage being delivered to your gadgets. It can charge at up to 100W, which is enough for many devices to quickly recharge.

* [$15 at AMAZON](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09KLYBS5H?tag=theverge02-20)

RELATED

#### The Vergeâ€™s Guide to Amazon Prime Day 2022

#### The Verge Prime Day 2022 live blog

What else is better to get us tech nerds excited like a speedy USB-C cable that can help you pinpoint which component in [our messy world of USB-C](https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/30/22702453/usb-c-pd-240-watt-charging-usb4-data-transfer-logo-branding-standard) is responsible for your slow charging times? Ever wonder why your laptop, Nintendo Switch, or Steam Deck is actually draining while you have it plugged in? This cable can tell you just how much any of your power adapters with detachable cables are outputting and if a manufacturer is promising you more wattage than it actually delivers to your electronics. (Note: if you want to check the output of those first-party power adapters for the Switch and Steam Deck â€” those ones with fixed cables â€” there are [other power meters available](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01NAWYSVK?tag=theverge02-20) that [are also on sale](https://www.amazon.com/MakerHawk-Multimeter-Multi-function-Capacity-Detector/dp/B07GQLYMR9?tag=theverge02-20).)

Personally, I just bought a nice, lengthy 100W USB-C cable, and I think Iâ€™m tempted to add this Chipofy one to my tangled ratsâ€™ nest of a drawer of cables. Because now I must test everything I own.

title: Decentralized Authorizations
body:
NEW - DIAGRAM: 

<https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVO-vhLZ4=/?share_link_id=983110859745>

Here is a new proposal for how documents in the real world might be signed on behalf of a DAO. This is intended as an open essay and is not a definitive guide nor is it legal advice. Thoughts and contributions are welcome!

**Process Flow for Decentralized Authorization:**

 1. A community vote occurs resulting in the need for the DAO to execute a written agreement in the real world (â€œExecution Eventâ€)
 2. Members of the community multisig review the community vote and ensure it was conducted in accordance with standard practice
 3. The multisig signs off on an â€œauthorizationâ€ to bind the DAO
 4. The â€œauthorizationâ€ is plugged into a smart contract (Ricardian)
 5. The Smart Contract also contains an independent contractor agreement, to be signed by an interested volunteer
 6. The DAO creates a bounty of $100 DAI (or stablecoin) and offers it to a pool of volunteers for the sole purpose of signing the real world document with DAO â€œauthorityâ€
 7. The independent contractor agreement conveys a limited purpose power of attorney with the contractor for the purpose of signing as the DAOâ€™s agent. The PoA specifies with great detail what the signer is authorized to do, and for what purpose. The PoA also specifies that all other powers / rights are expressly prohibited.
 8. The independent contractor agreement is minimal but contains a mutual indemnity (the Signer pool will be doxed and KYCâ€™d). So long as the Signer is acting within the scope of their authorization they are covered by the DAO, but if they sign outside scope of authorization (or any other document) - they are liable to the DAO and/or counterparty.
 9. A doxed and KYCâ€™d volunteer accepts the independent contractor agreement and signs it using their associated wallet (the â€œSignerâ€)
10. The Signer executes the written agreement on behalf of the DAO
11. The Signer is paid $100 DAI (or stablecoin) - either from the DAOâ€™s treasury or through an automated escrow release function
12. The smart contract auto-terminates upon completion

**Additional Considerations:**

* The multisig steps listed above may not be necessary at all. Depending on the â€œstructureâ€ of the DAO, these steps may be skipped and/or automated
* If applicable, the mutisig members would also have indemnity from the DAO so long as acting within scope of their authorization under the Operating Agreement (or other vesting source)
* A DAO implementing this function could further employ a control of ensuring that no more than five (5) bounties are awarded to any given individual signer in any year, to stay below the 1099 threshold for reporting. (Or the bounty amount could be increased up to the 1099 limit - this is not a necessary feature but simply called out for convenience)
* Counterparties may rely on apparent authority principles, however, for more formal signature requirements - part of the smart contract operation could also include auto-generation of an official document (similar to an officerâ€™s certification) on CityDAO letterhead showing the authorization has been granted to the signer.
* Either way, the smart contract would also have a read-only output for use in the real world to the extent necessary
* **NEW** - The indemnity in Section 8 could be replaced by an insurance pool. Orâ€¦
* **NEW - Posting a Bond.** The signer may be required to post a bond (say an NFT for example) and to place it into escrow - perhaps even the same escrow address as the bounty. The signer then performs their duty, and the bounty and NFT will be released back to the signer upon successful completion of the signature, proof of work, and official termination of the underlying agreement between the signer and the DAO
* \[Differences between U.S. recognized DAO business entities and true DAO protocols\]

title: Programmatic Negotiations
body:
Youâ€™ve spent every last painstaking second of Gladwellâ€™s proverbial 10,000 hours becoming a half way decent contract attorney when it hits you: most of that time was not working on contracts at all - it was wasted squinting at documents on a computer screen and playing mental games such as the old â€œwhat isnâ€™t here that should be?â€ and everyoneâ€™s favorite â€œat least they brought me in at the last second when I could really make a differenceâ€.

Well fellow squires and future magistrates - I say no more! What ifâ€¦ just stay with me nowâ€¦ what if we had **programmatic contract negotiations**?

There is no possible way I am the first to think of this, and its only for sheer ignorance that I canâ€™t point to the real inventor (and intentional ignorance in the form of not even googling before writing this) butâ€¦what if instead of pushing redlines back and forth with Sharon, the parties started the contract negotiation with a blank template that includes nothing except immaterial boilerplate.

Nearly every issue ever written into a contract has been thought of already (conceptually anyway).

So - A database could be created that includes every category of normal contract sections (i.e.. scope of work, compensation, term and termination, indemnity and insurance, and so onâ€¦ each a â€œContract Categoryâ€). There would be a primary Contract Category of standard commercial terms and many secondary Contract Categories based on the subject matter of the underlying transaction. Within the database, each and every Contract Category would have 3, 5, or 7 available provisions (any odd number), with each provision including a score range of favorability for each party. For example, if there are 3 indemnity provisions, the most mutually fair and agreeable provision is scored 0, the provision most favorable to the seller is scored +1, and the provision most favorable to the Buyer is scored -1.

Back to real life: Buyer and Seller decide to transact, and so their lawyers meet and confer. First, they agree on key parameters: (i) each party would select all of the primary and secondary (subject matter specific) categories it finds important, and (ii) the number of options within each Contract Category is agreed upon - it will be the same number of options for every category. Now a full roster of Contract Categories is generated. That was the big bang and we have the universe!

*Note - Least Cost Avoider application here or at Negotiation Points below? (or both?) Depends on if the parties can agree about where the risk even lies within the contract. However, some concepts on their face include more risk for one party over the other, and the most efficient outcome is for LCA to be applied any time risk profiles become clear on a particular Contract Category.*

Next, the parties would stipulate as to the Contract Categories they do not care about, and any such mutually agreeable poopooâ€™d Contract Categories would have provisions with a score of 0 populated into the template, alongside the immaterial boilerplate. Then for Contract Categories where one party does care and the other does not, the corresponding scored provision gets populated (in the example of 3 options; (-1) for Buyer and (+1) for Seller).

*Note - The weighted provisions get plugged into the template but these do NOT count towards the score below. Note - does this create perverse incentives to lie? (Yay we are buildingâ€¦â€¦).*

Now it gets fun. Each party would receive a roster of the remaining Contract Categories (the â€œKey Negotiation Pointsâ€ or â€œKNPsâ€ for short). Each party would then rank the KNPs in order of relative importance to such party (for example: ordering by 1 through **X**, where 1  = the partyâ€™s most important issue and X = the total number of KNPs, and the higher number would equate to lesser importance to such party). Once each party has completed its own order of KNPs, both partiesâ€™ order-scores for each KNP are combined and divided by two to arrive at the â€œOrder of Negotiationâ€ (or magnitude). Ties are resolved in favor of the KNP that receives the lowest single party order-score (for example, if two KNPs are tied at a combined order score of 8, and one was ranked 4,4 whereas the other was ranked 2,6 - the 2,6 KNP would prevail for Order of Negotiation purposes.

***IDEA 1: Each Party would then receive a number of tokens equal to 2\*X.***

***IDEA 2:***

***\[UNDER CONSTRUCTION - IF YOU READ THIS FAR YOU ARE FARTHER THAN YOU WERE SUPPOSED TO BE. JEEZ GIVE ME A DAY OR TWO AND THE WORM WILL BE FINISHED YOU EARLY BIRD. ITS LATE AND I AM TIRED AND NEED TO GET SOME SLEEP!! :-) \]***

I hear you screaming through the screen - what lawyer worth a tenth of an hour of their billable time would ever agree to do something that would cut down on billables?!?! Such madness!!

Well for this one - Iâ€™d rather be in the mountains or on a golf course instead of wondering why the customerâ€™s paper is so dreadfully archaic and one sided (watching the minutes tick away late on a Thursday nightâ€¦â€¦)

title: WIS V1.130 FAQs
body:
The team is currently doing final optimization and testing. Except for the functional modules in the preview. This version also carried out a lot of refactoring and optimization of the underlying modules.

All users are recommended to upgrade. Otherwise, there may be cases where the reward cannot be obtained.

Below is a summary of some recently received questions.

## Version related issues:

**Q: When will the V1.130 version be updated?**  
 A: July 15th at 10 pm New York time.

**Q: When will the V1.120 airdrop event end?**  
 A: July 15th at 9:00 pm New York time.

**Q: What are the resources needed to upgrade gems?**
A: The gem upgrade is 100% successful.
To upgrade, you need to consume 5 gems of a lower level to synthesize 1 gem of a higher level.
Different WIST and UMT will be consumed according to different gem levels.
Low-level gem upgrades only cost WIST.

**Q: Each PFP has 4 sockets for gems, so 10 PFPs can have 40 sockets for gems. Up to 210 gems in one account?**  
 A: The current version has a maximum storage space of 210 gems.  
 Gem storage space and **sockets** on each PFP are different.  
 Depending on the quality of the PFP, the storage space increases in different amounts. For example, Common level will only increase 1 gem storage space, and Epic level will increase 4 storage space.

**Q: How can I unlock the gem slot? Do gem slots have different properties?**
A: The slot can be unlocked when the PFP reaches level 5, 10, 15, 20.
Only gems of the corresponding color can be placed in different sockets.
Orange gems can be put into red and yellow slots.
Purple gems can be put into red and blue slots.
Rainbow gems can be placed in all slots.

**Q: Can I sell and buy gems?**
A: In version V1.130, gems can be sold at WIST or UMT prices in the WIS App.
But the minimum price cannot be less than 100 WIST or UMT.

**Q: Can gems be sold in third-party marketplaces?**
A: The current version does not work, it can only be sold and purchased in the WIS App.
But in future versions, the highest tier gems will be available for sale in any third-party marketplace.

**Q: How to organize my own team? Is it only possible to use my activation code?**
A: The "team" will be divided into several parts. In the next version, the team will include:
1 PFP used by users who have used user activation codes
2 PFP used by users who have bound the invitation address
3 All PFPs you own
4 In the Land version, the team will have new components

Each part will have different numerical effects in different gameplay.
In the current version, the numerical value has little impact, so you don't need to pay special attention.
If there are major numerical system changes, the team will announce more specific rules in advance.

## Other questions:

**Q: How to calculate the energy upper limit value?**
A: Depending on the amount of PFP held, up to 20 energy.
In addition, the currently used PFP quality will increase up to 4 additional energy.
That is, you can have up to 24 points of energy.

**Q: How long does it take for the energy to recover?**
A: 25% of energy is restored every 6 hours.

**Q: What can I do if the value has not been updated after UMT is transferred to the cloud wallet?** A: Click UMT, enter the Transfer interface, select UMT BEP-20, and click Refresh.

**Q: What can I do if the withdrawal of WIST to BEP-20 is not completed and clicking the retry button does not work?**

A: First, please make sure that the current address has enough BNB to pay the gas fee. In version V1.120, withdrawals within 72 hours can be retried using the Retry button. For more than 72 hours, please contact the technical team for assistance. In version V1.130, the retry time after withdrawal is extended to 30 days.

**Q: When will the PFP rental function be available?**
A: The promotion of leasing-related modules will only begin after the Land module is launched.

**Q: How much BNB does the PFP transfer cost? Are there any restrictions before and after the transfer?**
A: The transfer only requires Gas handling fee, which is generally less than 0.0005BNB under normal circumstances, and may fluctuate according to network conditions.
After the transfer, the PFP belongs to the receiving address, and the original address cannot be used again.
It may take several hours for new addresses to refresh after the transfer.

**Q: Will there be various language selection functions in the future?**
A: There will be a multi-language version, but it will be added after the version function is relatively complete.
During the Open Beta phase, there will be no multilingual support.

**Q: During exercise, if the phone is left standing still, will it consume energy and vitality?**
A: No, but the power value will be reduced due to prolonged immobility.

**Q: What is wallet backup?**  
 A: The built-in wallet function of WIS, like ordinary blockchain wallets (such as MetaMaskï¼ŒBitKeep etc.), requires users to back up and keep their mnemonics by themselves.  
 The wallet data will not be stored on the server.  
 If the user loses the application data and does not back it up, the data cannot be retrieved.

**Q: What is the difference between WIS Token and UMT token?**
A: WIST needs to be used in more functions. 95% of it comes from the internal system of the app and is generated by user behavior.
UMT is an ecological governance token with a pre-release part. The user behavior output of the app's internal system is 30% of the total.

**Q: How much UMT does it cost to reset properties?**
A: Currently there is no attribute reset function.
But in the V1.130 version, gems will add a lot of attributes.
You can try to use gems to tune the missing properties.

**Q: Why can OPPO brand mobile phones only run up to Power 5? Which phone sensor is the best?**
A: The sensor sensitivity of each mobile phone is different, and the next version will be optimized for each model.
There will also be some optimizations in the V1.130 release.

**Q: How is the gas fee for WIST and UMT transfers calculated?**
A: The gas cost given by the App is only a reference value. It will actually change according to the network situation, and it will generally be lower than the reference value.

**Q: How many users does WIS project have at present?**

A: The App currently has about 7K active users. Counting NFT and SBT holding addresses, as well as token holding addresses, it is estimated that there are about 12K active users.

**Q: Is it possible to display the vitality value of PFP on the page that is in motion?**
A: It has been optimized in the V1.130 version. There will be different prompts when vitality is less than 50% and 20%.

**Q: How does the vitality value of PFP affect the income and how to restore it?**
A: Vitality cannot be restored automatically, it needs to consume WIST to restore it. When the vitality is lower than 50%, the benefits of exercise are reduced by 10%, and when the vitality is lower than 20%, the benefits of exercise are reduced by 50%. Below 2%, earnings are reduced by 90%.

**Q: Can the PFP background color be the same as the sports venue background color to get more rewards? What does the current PFP background color do?**
A: The same color will increase a certain lucky value, which will affect the drop rate of the loot box.
When the Land version goes live, the effect of the motion background color will increase to other values.

**Q: When will WIST be traded?**
A: Because almost all WIST is generated by users, the team cannot help to establish a swap pool for WIST and other tokens.
When users obtain enough WIST, there may be exchange pools established by community users.

title: Konami Reinstating Delisted Metal Gear Games For Series' 35th Anniversary
body:
Konami is preparing to reinstate the Metal Gear games it temporarily removed from sale as the series celebrates its 35th anniversary.

As reported by [VGC](https://www.videogameschronicle.com/news/on-metal-gears-35th-anniversary-konami-says-its-preparing-to-bring-back-delisted-games/), Konami's Japanese Twitter account posted to commemorate the anniversary and announced that fans, seemingly soon, will once again be able to play [the temporarily suspended entries](https://www.ign.com/articles/metal-gear-solid-games-removed-from-sale-temporary).

"The Metal Gear series, released on July 13, 1987, celebrated its 35th anniversary today," it said. "We are preparing to resume sales of titles that have been temporarily suspended."

This could refer to the versions of Metal Gear Solid 2 and 3 that were removed from digital storefronts last November following license renewal issues.

Konami said at the time: "We are currently working on renewing the licenses for select historical archive footage used in-game, therefore, we have made the temporary decision to begin suspending the sale of Metal Gear Solid 2, Metal Gear Solid 3, and all products that include these games from digital storefronts globally starting from November 8, 2021."

## FAQ Terkait Layanan UNTUNG88

Berikut beberapa pertanyaan yang sering diajukan oleh para pengguna maupun para calon pelanggan kami:

### (Q1). Bagaimana cara bukan akun member di UNTUNG88?

Jawab: untuk membuat akun member di UNTUNG88 sangatlah mudah, kalain cukup ikuti langkah-langkah berikut ini:

1. Masuk ke homepage situs resmi UNTUNG88.
2. Klik tombol â€œDaftarâ€ di pojok kanan atas.
3. Isilah kolom yang dibutuhkan dengan data yang benar.
4. Konfirmasi bahwa kalian telah berusia 18 tahun.
5. Klik Daftar lalu silakan masuk dengan data login yang dibuat.

### (Q2). Apakah UNTUNG88 merupakan situs tepercaya?

Jawab: situs kami merupakan situs terpercaya yang telah beroperasi selama bertahun-tahun dalam melayani permainan judi dari Indonesia dan Asia.

Lokasi kantor kami berada di Manila, Filipina dan mendapatkan lisensi PACGOR yang membuktikan bahwa kami merupakan layanan tepercaya yang seluruh data transaksi keuangan kalian menjadi privasi yang kami jaga serta kemenangan member yang pasti dibayar.

### (Q3). Bagaimana cara deposit ke akun UNTUNG88 milik saya?

Jawab: untuk bisa bermain berbagai macam layanan yang kami miliki, kalian harus melakukan deposit terlebih ke dahulu ke akun kalian menggunakan sistem deposit:

* Online deposit
* Bank lokal: BCA, BNI, BRI, MANDIRI, CIMB NIAGA dan DANAMON

### (Q4). Apa sajakah mata uang yang didukung oleh UNTUNG88?

Jawab: Saat ini, mata uang yang diterima oleh UNTUNG88 ialah mata uang Rupiah (IDR) dengan perhitungan berbasis poin IDR dengan ketentuan:

1 poin IDR = Rp 1.000

### (Q5).  Apakah ada batas taruhan minimal dalam betting?

Jawab: Tiap jenis permainan yang disediakan di UNTUNG88 memiliki batas taruhan minimal yang perlu kalian pertaruhkan.

Batas permainan ini tidak bisa diubah karena sudah keputusan pihak UNTUNG88 serta pihak provider penyedia layanan. Kalian akan diberi informasi terkait hal ini saat pertama kali masuk permainan.

title: 3. Dragonia, Cryptovania, Silly Seals, Lyra, Lens Protocol, Public Goods
body:
3rd Weekly Twitter Space covering the Optimism ecosystem.

\*\*Collect and own this episode as an NFT!

* 0.005 ETH mint, limited collection of 10 NFTs.
* Proceeds are re-invested to grow the podcast and expand crypto education.

## Listen to the Recording:

[https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/3-dragonia-cryptovania-silly-seals-lyra-lens-protocol/id1626927963?i=1000564795680](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/3-dragonia-cryptovania-silly-seals-lyra-lens-protocol/id1626927963?i=1000564795680)

[https://open.spotify.com/episode/3Ga9OV9xxrSMn2iaI4Iksk?si=Srsspj6iTWWfeK9wnkYlzA](https://open.spotify.com/episode/3Ga9OV9xxrSMn2iaI4Iksk?si=Srsspj6iTWWfeK9wnkYlzA)

## Show Notes

**Key Takeaways:**

* Optimism is decentralizing, taking token live, OP will give out OP tokens for people building public goods on optimism.
* Lens Protocol is the next iteration of decentralized social media.
* â€œNFTs have never really made sense to me, you need utility, it needs to do somethingâ€
* The younger generation will understand crypto. This will be the generation not talking about it, but using it. And it will be embedded in everything.
* Stories (via Cryptovania) could be a positive externality for the world.
* Talent: The people who really know what theyâ€™re doing are going to be working on the most decentralized, secure, and strong places. During the next cycle, when the masses of people come back to the crypto space, the usable applications will be on the strongest chains because the developers have built things here.
* People donâ€™t care about security from a marketing standpoint, but if youâ€™re selling someone something, you better make sure that you are being secure with how you store their data.
* You are not a customer, you are a sovereign individual entity.
* Web2 is what you use, web3 is what you own.
* Decentralization is a must, anonymity is a choice.

**Intros:**

Abraxas, Jrocki, and Espresso kick off the call talking surfing, nomad life, travel, building roots, and more.

Vision: cover the user side of web3 and various dapps and users coming onboard to the blockchain space.

**Quick Takes:**

* Opportunities in public goods funding. Optimism is decentralizing, taking token live, OP will give out OP tokens for people building public goods on optimism.
* OP wants to give out their token to people who are building things. You need to submit a proposal. The token house votes on the proposals to approve or deny is.

**Lyra protocol** (options protocol on Optimism) submitted a proposal to give tokens to builders, liquidity providers, and traders.

* A portion will go to non-technical things such as education, podcasts, newsletters, educational videos, etc.
* Liquidity providers - providing liquidity to the protocol Lyra, for traders, so that users can trade for free.
* 10% of these will be retroactive funding, for anyone who has built things on top of lyra or supported lyra in some way.
* Opportunities for both technical as well as non-technical users.

**Lens Protocol:** Lens is the next iteration of decentralized social media.

* Lens is the first attempt that looks very promising â€œuser owned content and social relationshipsâ€
* With Lens, you can own your own data.
* Whereas on Facebook or Twitter, they own your data and the ad revenue.
* Decentralized social media gives creators the ability to monetize and participate in revenue sharing.
* Unfortunately Lens is still in private launch, hoping for a public launch soon.
* Follow espresso.lens.

**Abraxas**: Teacher, formerly a coordinator for adult literacy. Involved in both teaching as well as web3 projects.

* Cares about education, equality, and how a lack of education can limit opportunities.
* Got into public education with a masterâ€™s degree.
* Took out retirement funds and started investing.
* Heard about â€œInvest like the Bestâ€ with Patrick Oâ€™Shaunessy.
* Listened to Justin Drakeâ€™s episode on this podcast, and went down the rabbit hole of crypto.
* Setup a Metamask wallet after experimenting with centralized exchanges.
* Came over to Optimism last summer.
* Was still pretty expensive last summer
* Got into Polygon, and things like Fantom. Ended up losing some money
* The OP token launch sparked his interest as well
* Loved the idea of democratizing access to financial tools.
* Wanted to find a reason to be involved, which for Abraxas, was public goods funding initiatives.
* â€œNFTs have never really made sense to me, you need utility, it needs to do somethingâ€
* The quickest way to get involved was to buy or mint something.
* Got involved with Dragonia project on Optimism. Crowley from the Dragonia team likes Abraxasâ€™s participation on Discord, and asked him to be a community manager.
* **As a teacher, do you ask your students about web3?**
  * A little bit, but Roblox: every kid plays roblox.
  * It is a game as well as a social network, where you can talk to friends etc.
  * The younger generation will understand crypto. This will be the generation not talking about it, but using it. And it will be embedded in everything.
  * You could in theory take your roblox skin and go play Fortnite, for example.
  * This is probably how games will look in the future.. like Metaverses.
* **Dragonia** is an entire ecosystem.
  * The trainers are the focus and the utility.
  * Like a less complex magic the gathering game, similar to rock paper scissors.
  * There will be 9999 3 different rarities, give you access to the whole ecosystem, play to earn.
  * Trainer NFTs allow you to earn passive income.
  * Portions of the fees are distributed to holders.
  * You earn experience which can be exchanged for rewards.
  * Also whitelist spots on partner projects.
  * Wen mint? June timeframe.
  * All earnings will be distributed in ETH.
  * People can use their trainer to vote for changes.
  * Abraxas also spent time explaining how the game works. Portion will go to public goods.

**Odysseus:** Soon to drop a collection on Optimism, Silly Seals.

* A portion goes to public goods.
* Odysseus is a budding dev, working with a web2 company now.
* Using solidity for the NFT project, and also Synthetix
* ***Why layer 2, why Optimism?***
  * As a synthetix guy, he is very committed to decentralization.
  * Loves the Optimism vision for things like public goods and paying teachers what they are worth for example.
* **What is synthetix?** It is a protocol that provides a pool of capital for things like trades.
  * Dividends are paid out based on profits to stakers.

**Fractal Visions:** Runs a fine art printing business on canvas.

* Got into the NFT space in the last year and a half.
* Sold 3 pieces for an artist with health troubles in Peru on Rarible for 1 eth each.
* The NFT space has been empowering for artists.
* Enrolled in a Dapp university course to learn.
* Loves the Quixotic vision and the digital revolution of art that NFTs is creating.
* So many people in the real world who collect art are still not a part of the NFT space yet.
* Runs the Ganland NFT projects.
* Artists should be paid for their work.

**Cryptovania:** Lexx and Mark

* Giving away mint passes
* Today, metaverses are centrally developed, hard to deliver on, and hard to access.
* They are building a â€œStoryverseâ€ with Cryptovania
* Cryptovania is an NFT project centered around storytelling.
* Stored on IPFS, which is decentralized. Plain text stories.
* Stories could be a positive externality for the world.
* Cryptovania is a return to the fundamentals of storytelling.
* Bottom-up approach: You could build an entire metaverse around these stories in the future.
* Proceeds from the mint will go towards a bounty system, where whoever has the most upvoted stories will be paid for writing a good story.

**Why web3?**

* The value does not accrue back to people in the communities.
* Impact = Profit, in theory on Optimism.
* If you write a good story, you can benefit from that In web1 and web2, the only people who benefitted were those with a really big following.
* There was not a lot of value accrual back to the creator.
* Quixotic is also working on an NFT bridge.
* Badge style NFTs: things earned rather than bought. Transferable or non-transferrable. Dark Forest issued friendship cards, for example.

**Why Optimism?** Why not fantom or avalanche where gas fees are lower?

* Other chains donâ€™t scale as well.
* On high usage, fees still go high.
* A lot of volume could crash the network.
* Optimism is more robust, you wonâ€™t have that problem because it inherits its security and uptime from Ethereum.
* Over time, talent is the only thing that will survive. The people who are really invested in the space and know what theyâ€™re doing are going to be working on the most decentralized, secure, and strong places like Optimism or Arbitrum or Ethereum. So during the next cycle, when the masses of people come back to the crypto space, the usable applications will be on the strongest chains because the developers have built things here.
* You donâ€™t care about security until you need it, and then you care about it a whole lot.
* Terra ecosystem did not thing about this until it was too late, for example.
* As more crazy stuff happens, some of these alternative layer 1â€™s could have similar token or security concerns.
* On Optimism, as more people trade, it gets cheaper because they can compress the date on each block more effectively.
* Decentralization is an important pre-requisite for blockchain. Instead of decentralization, we can use the word â€œsecurityâ€.
* Layer 2â€™s share security fundamentals with Ethereum.
* Decentralization and Security will never be big selling points from a consumer perspective, although it is extremely important.
* People donâ€™t care about security from a marketing standpoint, but if youâ€™re selling someone something, you better make sure that you are being secure with how you store their data.
* You are not a customer, you are a sovereign individual entity.
* Web2 is what you use, web3 is what you own.
* Decentralization is a must, anonymity is a choice.
* 1 token 1 vote - positives and negatives about this. We want to be careful about power games.

title: Dr. Campbell Harvey - DeFi and the Future of Finance
body:
Dr. Campbell Harvey is a Professor at Duke University where he teaches *Innovation and Cryptoventures.* He also teaches [Decentralized Finance (DeFi): The Future of Finance](https://www.coursera.org/specializations/decentralized-finance-duke) on Coursera.

He is the author of the book [Defi and the Future of Finance](https://www.amazon.com/DeFi-Future-Finance-Campbell-Harvey/dp/1119836018/ref=sr_1_3), to which Vitalik Buterin wrote the Preface and Fred Ehrsam the Foreward.

He has published papers on finance, crypto, and beyond. His most recent, [An Investorâ€™s Guide to Crypto](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4124576), is available on SSRN, published June 2022.

\*\*Collect and own this episode as an NFT!

* 0.01 ETH mint, limited collection of 111 NFTs.
* Proceeds are re-invested to grow the podcast and expand crypto education.

## Listen to the Recording:

[https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/dr-campbell-harvey-defi-and-the-future-of-finance/id1626927963?i=1000569243760](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/dr-campbell-harvey-defi-and-the-future-of-finance/id1626927963?i=1000569243760)

[https://open.spotify.com/episode/7xI6KHIoZCQIekC8S14WEO?si=2SrWFPjwSUCEaqtV_-4VzQ](https://open.spotify.com/episode/7xI6KHIoZCQIekC8S14WEO?si=2SrWFPjwSUCEaqtV_-4VzQ)

I highly recommend checking out Dr. Campbell Harveyâ€™s course, book, and paper, linked below.

**Decentralized Finance, via Coursera:**

[https://www.coursera.org/specializations/decentralized-finance-duke](https://www.coursera.org/specializations/decentralized-finance-duke)

**DeFi and the Future of Finance, the book.**

I read the book and specifically enjoyed the coverage of many concepts we often hear about, yet might not have as good of a true understanding as weâ€™d like (burn, mint, bonding curve, consensus mechanisms, portability, oracles, and more).

I also enjoyed learning about five of the biggest problems within centralized finance, which DeFi can help solve. The implications in solving these problems are huge - for both equality of opportunity as well as economic growth.

[https://www.amazon.com/DeFi-Future-Finance-Campbell-Harvey/dp/1119836018/ref=sr_1_3](https://www.amazon.com/DeFi-Future-Finance-Campbell-Harvey/dp/1119836018/ref=sr_1_3)

**An Investorâ€™s Guide to Crypto, published on SSRN:** in the show, he mentions footnote 4, which includes selected projects from 20 different areas in the blockchain space, such as layer 1, layer 2, defi, privacy, NFTs, gaming, metaverse, social networks, identity, bridges, etc.

[https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4124576](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4124576)

**Show Notes, Key Takeaways:**

* â€œWeâ€™re right at the beginning of this disruptionâ€.
* On Satoshi Nakamotoâ€™s 2008 Bitcoin Whitepaper: â€œIts the sort of paper that potentially changes the way things work in the world.â€
* A statement made by a student who took his [course](https://www.coursera.org/specializations/decentralized-finance-duke): â€œOver the past couple of years Iâ€™m in so many conversations where people are talking about crypto, and I was just a wallflower. But after your course, Iâ€™m in the mix. I can ask questions, and I can ask good questions.â€
* â€œBeing able to see-through the incorrect and mistaken statements that we so often hear is important.â€
* â€œWhat you should look at is not the price of the crypto, but the interests of the venture capitalists. And they love it right now.â€
* â€œWe need to look beyond the price movement, and figure out what problems exist, and figure out if the technology can solve the problem, while maintaining a realistic time-frame.â€
* â€œYou donâ€™t need a degree in computer science. What you need is to be creative - to identify problems that could be solved with this space, and just jump in.â€

**Intros:**

Dr. Campbell Harvey has been in the space since 2013. He was formerly editor of Journal of Finance.

When he got back into teaching the international finance course he thought it would be valuable to add a section on bitcoin.

He read the Satoshi white paper, and realized it was a foundational idea.

It was a vary niche idea in 2013.

He was surprised it was not published in one of the top journals â€“ it was the type of paper that every academic strives to have. â€œIts the sort of paper that potentially changes the way things work in the world.â€

**Creating a course on crypto at Duke**

Decides to devote a lecture to cryptocurrency.

Enlists a colleague (who turned out to be an undergrad student) from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill to help with preparing for the blockchain topics and cryptocurrency course.

The student, as a bitcoin developer, goes on to finish at Duke in 3 years, later joining startup in Silicon Valley. (The story as told in the episode is really worth a listen!)

Professor Harvey delivers his lecture on crypto and blockchain, and the students end up staying late after class, sharing the transformational impact that the lecture had.

That single lecture evolved into a course at Duke, as well as four courses on Coursera in Decentralized Finance. The book is based on the course.

Nowadays, he teaches less on traditional finance and more decentralized finance.

After taking his courses, one student expressed: â€œOver the past couple of years Iâ€™m in so many conversations where people are talking about crypto, and I was just a wallflower. But after your course, Iâ€™m in the mix. I can ask questions, and I can ask good questionsâ€¦â€

**Risk**

Half of the book is about risk.

You need to understand the risks. Finance is not only about expected returns, but about assessing the risks.

The material for *Innovation and Cryptoventures* changes so quickly -- every semester there is new material due to the fast paced nature of the crypto industry.

**Blockchain Conference assignment**

One semester, an assignment for the course was to attend a blockchain conference, and make note of false statement that so-called expert panelists say.

This assignment highlighted the importance of being able to determine if someone thinks they know something but they donâ€™t really know.

Being able to see-through the incorrect and mistaken statements that we so often hear is important.

Co-authors of the book are former teaching assistants of the course.

â€œWeâ€™re right at the beginning of this disruptionâ€

**Recent paper, *Investorâ€™s Guide to Crypto* was published in June 2022 on SSRN.**

In traditional finance, if you donâ€™t like the volatility, you can take a diversify between risky assets and stable assets. Similar principles can be applied to crypto.

Volatility should be expected in these markets.

It is a mistake to look at only bitcoin and ether.

See footnote 4 in the [paper](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4124576), which sketches 20 different areas in the blockchain space, such as layer 1, layer 2, defi, privacy, NFTs, gaming, metaverse, social networks, identity, bridges, etc.

The basic lessons of diversification should be taken into account.

There are a few sections on active strategies.

The paper also debunks a few valuation models - for example, coupling the valuation of bitcoin to the value of gold metal.

In 2019-2020, based on the number of Coinbase and Robinhood wallets, the number of speculators in the space increased.

**Risk-on vs. Risk-off investments**

* Risk-off assets: People buy safer assets like US Treasury Bonds.
* Risk-on assets: once we had a vaccine, people tended to get back into risky assets.
* Risk-on assets tend to be dumped during tumultuous times, such as March 2020 when COVID hit. The stock market dipped 35%, bitcoin dropped 55%.

**Custody:**

If you lose your private keys, you lose your crypto. This is a risk management challenge for people.

Fidelity and Coinbase Pro are entering into the custodial space. This increases the ability for institutional investors to enter the space.

**Regulatory:**

ETFs, however, have faced regulatory challenges.

Dr. Harvey has written twice to the SEC suggesting the approval of ETFs.

We donâ€™t have a lot of regulatory guidance today. It is hilarious to think that crypto fits into the securities act of 1933. If youâ€™re a security, you need a transfer agent, which is an algorithm in DeFi. Regulators donâ€™t have an easy job.

If we impose regulations that are too harsh, then innovations go off-shore. If regulation is too lax, then people will be taken advantage of.

It is difficult to find a middle ground. It takes a lot of time.

We should have a safe harbor period.

**Broad potentials of blockchain**

1\.7 billion people in the world are unbanked.

In web3, your bank is your smartphone. No transferring money from banks - you simply link your wallet.

There is no web3 without decentralized finance. You can pay for stuff, but you can also be paid.

This technology offers the promise of making the economy much more efficient.

Bankers tend to prefer to deal with larger customers, and give larger customers the best deals.

Smaller projects are thus more difficult to start-up today with traditional financing.

If we can solve this problem, we can increase investment, increase growth, and real GDP.

We eventually need to pay down our debt - the answer is growth.

We can bump growth between 5-8%.

â€œWhat you should look at is not the price of the crypto, but the interests of the venture capitalists. And they love it right nowâ€.

**Dapps and Web3 Wallets**

Dapps are different - whereas something like twitter is a centralized app, something like Metamask is opensource and you can see the code on Github.

You canâ€™t do DeFi without a decentralized app.

**NFTs class:**

Professor Harvey teaches a lecture on NFTs.

Prices are likely to go down on digital art.

The class on NFTs focuses on applications of NFTs that will be important in the future.

The NFT monetization model seems to be much more beneficial to artists than for traditional model with galleries.

All students have a Metamask wallet.

Students in the class create NFTs. For example: [Campbell Harvey teaching how to create an NFT](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x495f947276749ce646f68ac8c248420045cb7b5e/50561657042432192467685888375638478561674832866731720087550735600749304086529)

There is a class token, and they get rewards for doing certain things, like asking good questions of suggesting a change in wording.

Students get a reward for visiting the Bitcoin and Ethereum mining operation at Duke. Students take a selfie in front of the miners, and post that selfie as an NFT as proof that they were thereâ€¦ Proof of Attendance.

**Use cases for NFTs:**

* Augmented Reality fashion - all the big fashion houses have NFT initiatives. At London Fashion week there was a half day on digital fashion.
  * Beyond this, the metaverse is a huge future application of NFTs.
* POAPs / certificates of completion, proof of attendance.
* Ticketing and artist / fan interaction. Fans could buy tickets, songs, or merch directly from the artist. An NFT from a show or concert could form a small community among fans. Direct interaction between community and artist.
* Identity: Eventually, you wonâ€™t need credit cards and debit cards - it could all be linked to the identity NFT.
  * University degrees, for example, would have to be non-transferrable. Its easy track on-chain if someone purchased a university degree or if it is counterfeit.

We need to look beyond the price movement, and figure out what problems exist, and figure out can the technology solve the problem, while maintaining a realistic time-frame.

**Web 1, 2, and 3**

* Web1: a way to access information. Only a way to consume content.
* Web2: social. Creating community like Twitter, Facebook, etc.
* Web3: the ability to transfer value. People who designed the initial browsers thought we would have digital currency, but they failed. Blockchain solves the double spend problem and makes it possible.

**Crypto cycles and the internet bubble - weâ€™re early**

Even during and after the crash of the internet bubble, the internet didnâ€™t go away. The strong firms remain. We can expect similar situations across cryptocurrency bull-bear cycles.

There will be spectacular failures, and spectacular successes.

The key thing is that weâ€™re early. And its always an advantage to be there at this point where itâ€™s really early.

Traditional financial institutions will likely be doing much smaller things.

You need to be the disruptor, not the disrupted. This space offers a lot of potential to be the disruptor.

You donâ€™t need a degree in computer science. What you need is to be creative - to identify problems that could be solved with this space, and just jump in.

title: 2. Quixotic NFT Marketplace, OptiPunk Giveaway, Dapps, IPFS, Warpspeed Bridge
body:
2nd Weekly Twitter Space covering the Optimism Ecosystem: Quixotic NFT marketplace, Dapps, and more.

\*\*Collect and own this episode as an NFT!

* 0.005 ETH mint, limited collection of 10 NFTs.
* Proceeds are re-invested to grow the podcast and expand crypto education.

## Listen to the Recording:

[https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/2-quixotic-nft-marketplace-optimistic-ape-giveaway/id1626927963?i=1000564612420](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/2-quixotic-nft-marketplace-optimistic-ape-giveaway/id1626927963?i=1000564612420)

[https://open.spotify.com/episode/2CVmRgSrvxXNvfyXlPsYp5](https://open.spotify.com/episode/2CVmRgSrvxXNvfyXlPsYp5)

*Crypto is how you program money. Money is how you program people.*

## Why would a developer want to build on Optimism?

The answer is incentives.

"Incentives motivate behavior."

The ecosystem needs developers to actually BUILD DAPPS on Optimism.

Why should a developer want to use Optimism as opposed to any other blockchain network?

Incentives to build on Optimism: the â€œOptimism Governance Fundâ€ donates money to teams and projects that have built useful things for the community.

These useful projects are known as â€œpublic goodsâ€.

The idea here is to reward those that contribute in positive ways.. incentivizing new developers to launch their dapps on Optimism.

* Public Goods make people want to join an ecosystem. Science is and example of a public good that is valuable to society.
* With retroactive public goods, whatever turns out to be the most valuable tends to be retroactively rewarded after proving its product-market fit. This is the opposite of traditional venture capital firms that go out to fund a bunch of different ideas without knowing for sure what will succeed.

## Why Did You Get into into Optimism Ecosystem??

\*\*\*jrocki.eth \*\*\*- Twitter Spaces Co-host. supported Optimism during OptiPunks launch because of Public Goods Funding Infrastructure.

***Mark, Co-Founder of Quixotic.io:***

Mark was a software engineer at an ad-tech company. Later learned about ETH, Optimism, and the possibility to host projects on IPFS.

* Participated in ETH global hackathon in 2021â€¦ involved with Feudals Ethereum communityâ€¦ worked on some various developments in Ethereum.
* Looked at other Layer 1â€™s, saw the high cost of trading NFTs on L2. Saw Layer 2â€™s as the future. Wanted to build something and make something happen in the space.
* Build / launch Quixotic.io
* Currently building CryptoVania / Storyverse on IPFS

## On Building + Dapps in the Optimistic Rollup space:

Even though the markets are down it feels like the builders are full-steam ahead.

On the Space, Mark raised the question: what do users need for adoption to increase?

**One specific need** was brought up: we need a decentralized app store / decentralized app platform.

* For example, you donâ€™t see substack app on the App Store. Why not? Because App Stores take too big of a cut due to policies around in app purchases etc. Effectively creates a roughly 30% markup on everything.
* Browser apps are harder to block and shut down, however, performance and computation are more difficult in browser.
* Huge opportunity for decentralized apps.

**IPFS** - communication and naming protocol. Similar to bittorrent, everyone can access files on IPFS thru peer to peer network.

* With Brave Browser you can visit IPFS, similar to using http.
* If no one is pinning the file, it might be really slow. So, you can pay someone in Filecoin or Pinata to pay the network to access the file, if no one pins it.

**Warp speed bridge** - standard protocol level bridge for optimismâ€¦Eth in escrow / burns the eth etc. Came out of a project called teleportal.

**Storj** - startup for decentralized storage. They encrypt your file.. many copies of the data in little chunks. Users of dropbox could move to something like this - around $7 per month for $1 TB.

title: 1. NFTs on Optimism - OptiPunks, public goods funding, market conditions ft. Jrocki.eth and Bodo
body:
PILOT EPISODE - 1st Weekly Twitter Space covering the Optimism NFT ecosystem: OptiPunks, Public Goods Funding, and more.

\*\*Collect and own this episode as an NFT!

* 0.0025 ETH mint, limited collection of 10 NFTs.
* Proceeds are re-invested to grow the podcast and expand crypto education.

## Listen to the Recording:

[https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/1-nfts-on-optimism-optipunks-public-goods-funding-market/id1626927963?i=1000564612640](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/1-nfts-on-optimism-optipunks-public-goods-funding-market/id1626927963?i=1000564612640)

[https://open.spotify.com/episode/6KzVFpIoxUNoyABQNpwopM](https://open.spotify.com/episode/6KzVFpIoxUNoyABQNpwopM)

**Overview: NFT Projects on Optimism:**

* Optipunks: original NFT on optimism. 100% of mint went to public goods funding. 50% of secondary went to public goods. Royalties on secondary is 2.5%...
* the OptiPunks community voted to decide which project funds would go towards.
* Optimistic Apes: Another project available on Quixotic... Sounded like a lot of us on the call minted or purchased some. The artist is still a mystery!
* Circular art, generative art platform designed to fund public goods

**What are public goods?**

* Examples of public goods include libraries, roads, open-source software (like ether.js).
* Paid for by the community (funded thru taxes, for example)
* Benefit everyone using the ecosystem.
* "retroactive public goods funding" - if people did something positive, community can vote to allocate money / rewards for building useful things.
* Public goods solve the market inequality of positive externalities.

*Join us every Monday at 4pm PST / 7pm EST on Twitter. Hosted by Jrocki (@Reformed_Normie) and Espresso (@Espressoinsight).*

Batas permainan ini tidak bisa diubah karena sudah keputusan pihak UNTUNG88 serta pihak provider penyedia layanan. Kalian akan diberi informasi terkait hal ini saat pertama kali masuk permainan.
