title: Blockchains for Normies
body:
### DESCRIPTION

A first-step guide to raise your knowledge about blockchainsâ€™ architecture. This article is a selection of various materials, including articles and videos, arranged in the chronological order to achieve the highest level of effectiveness in step-by-step learning.

I have to clarify â€“ thatâ€™s NOT a guide for total beginners in crypto. All content mentioned in the article is for those who are aware of the basic terminology & crypto market in general. FYI, the guide is based on my personal experience.

### CONTENTS

**DESCRIPTION
PART 1 - INTRODUCTION
PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS
2\.1 - Ethereum
2\.2 - Cosmos
2\.3 - Rollups
2\.4 - Solana
2\.5 - Near
PART 3 - CONCLUSION**

> Hey, thanks for checking out! If you donâ€™t like author to be talkative, just skip the introduction and jump directly to **PART 2**.

## PART 1 - INTRODUCTION

Lately, Iâ€™ve heard a lot of similar opinions like â€œThatâ€™s the best time to prepare yourself for the next bull marketâ€ or â€œGet out of charts and do some education insteadâ€. If you actively participated in all the â€œdegenâ€ plays with tokens and NFTs, or were busy as a day-trader for a while, Iâ€™d presume there wasnâ€™t enough time for such a silly thing as an **Education**. But isnâ€™t that finally a perfect time as people keep telling us? What if we shift our focus to learn something fundamental? Of course, Itâ€™s always nice to earn money by investing or speculating on one or another asset. Especially, when we saw such a great performance of most of the projects and especially blockchains in 2021.

![ATOM/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8eJdnSpY41ZFz7qR1dRUx.png?height=1189&width=1813)

![SOL/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zftEaJUKtu7syUpofERTE.png?height=1190&width=1820)

And Iâ€™m sure many of you got extremely good profits along with that rise. But here are few questions â€œ**Were you aware that LUNAâ€™s death loop is inevitable? Did you try to buy this dip?â€.** I have a feeling there are some, at least, who were not and tried so (*either was I*). Letâ€™s not make the same mistakes again. Without further more (*I know you may get tired of a long introduction*) letâ€™s jump into what I prepared for you.

## PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS

So, education, huh? What can we start with? Iâ€™ve been thinking and perceived to start with just fundamental things â€“ **Blockchains** and **Ecosystems**. If youâ€™re interested in boosting your knowledge about blockchains and crypto in general, below youâ€™ll find a selection of the related articles/videos. I found them extremely useful and perfectly fit for non-tech guys or â€œnormiesâ€.

> I have to clarify that the author is aware about whitepapers and other official resources, and that it is the best way to get familiar with functionality of blockchains and crypto protocols. But since the topic of this article is â€œ**Blockchains for Normies**â€, I prepared a selection of easy to understand materials to form a basic knowledge of structure and understanding of various tech aspects.

### 2.1 - ÎTHEREUM

We will start with the leading blockchain, the father of Smart contracts, DeFi and NFT â€“ **ETHEREUM**. Some of you could react as â€œWHAT?! Where the heck is Bitcoin??â€. Iâ€™m not a big fan of Bitcoin, to be honest, and, since the concept of both blockchains is pretty similar (*in relation to **proof-of-work** mechanism; please donâ€™t kill me, I know there is a big difference called **EVM** - **Ethereum Virtual Machine***), I decided to start with that. The amazing article translated into various languages: 
 [How does Ethereum work, anyway?](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-ethereum-work-anyway). 
 (*I recommend to read it in English since improving English skills is our next big goal â€“ more about that later*).

> If you really decided to dive into all of these things, follow the chronology, since I organized that for better understanding of the whole blockchain theory. Terms met in the first articles can be mentioned in the following ones.

Also, itâ€™s quite compatible to watch this video in parallel with the first article:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s)

(*Especially if youâ€™re not familiar at all with **Decentralized finances**, **DApps** & **Smart contracts***).

### 2.2 - COSMOS

Okay, weâ€™ve learnt some basic things about how the amazing technology of blockchain actually works. But you may ask â€œWhat about **proof-of-stake** concept? I heard many blockchains are based on it as on more energy efficient & more scalable analogueâ€ (*or just â€œWhatâ€™s next?â€*). Not a big deal â€“ the whole **validation & delegation** idea is greatly described in the next article about COSMOS ecosystem (*in 2 parts*):
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 1)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-1)
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 2)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-2)

â€Damn, man, youâ€™re just sending the articles of one particular authorâ€¦ You could send us her link and finish itâ€ â€“ ITâ€™S NOT MY FAULT that her articles are such great for normies. But donâ€™t judge me so fast, here will be more stuff.

### 2.3 - ROLLUPS

As long as weâ€™re aware about the difference between **proof-of-stake** and **proof-of-work** mechanisms, letâ€™s talk about another hot topic â€“ **ZK ROLLUPS**. Thatâ€™s almost impossible you havenâ€™t seen at least some videos or threads about how promising rollups are, determining it as a next huge trend. I guess, thatâ€™s worthy not to put it away: [A normie's guide to rollups](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/a-normies-guide-to-rollups).
And the answer for â€œWhich one is the best finally in that infinite battle?â€ can be found [here](https://medium.com/offchainlabs/optimistic-rollups-the-present-and-future-of-ethereum-scaling-60fb9067ae87) and [here](https://blog.polygon.technology/zk-and-the-future-of-ethereum-scaling/).

**Spoiler:**
.
.
.
Nobody knows exactly.

### 2.4 - Sâ—LANA

Next is **SOLANA**. The killer of Etheâ€¦ Okay, stop it. Nobody kills nobody. I guess weâ€™ve settled that long time ago, heh. We can start with this article giving us an idea of how the Solanaâ€™s **proof-of-history** concept works:
[What Is Solana (SOL)? Learn About Ethereumâ€™s Growing Rival](https://blockworks.co/what-is-solana-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-ethereum-rival/).

Then check out this video:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2)

And read the explanation by Solanaâ€™s founder Anatoly Yakovenko:
[Proof of History: A Clock for Blockchain](https://medium.com/solana-labs/proof-of-history-a-clock-for-blockchain-cf47a61a9274).

Seems more or less clear? I have to admit there are a lot of concerns and humors regarding Solanaâ€™s eligibility and transparency, especially regarding the concept of **proof-of-history**. But letâ€™s leave it for scientists and mathematicians like [Victor Shoup](https://www.shoup.net/papers/poh.pdf) (*You may* *have a look at it, but be careful, it can hurt your brain if youâ€™re not a sort of such guys*).

### 2.5 - NEAR

Letâ€™s dive a little deeper and remind ourselves about **Ethereum 2.0**, its **proof-of-stake** mechanism and, what is the most important, learn about **sharding** technology (*we need it for better understanding of the functionality of our next candidate*). I have to warn you, this part is gonna be more complex comparing to the previous ones:
[Detailed overview of Ethereum 2.0 shard chains: Committees, Proposers and Attesters](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/detailed-overview-of-ethereum-2-0-shard-chains-committees-proposers-and-attesters-a9992d2fd103). (*Well, at least I felt this way*).

> Please note that TxFlow is not relevant at the moment. Itâ€™s still under development and testing, so you can skip it for now.

Great! Iâ€™m feeling how these articles are becoming easier and easier to deal with (*or not, because you just keep scrolling?!*).

![Author when you don't read the article carefully](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ufWQTbVfyKHwNPAGqPXyM.png?height=900&width=1333)

To be honest, I spent several days trying to find similar easy to read material about the **NEAR** Protocol, but either it was huge, either quite complicated. Finally here it is, right after I spent the whole day reading an official doc (*super lucky?*). But first, if youâ€™re not familiar with the Near protocol at all, briefly check this introduction from the official team: [The Beginnerâ€™s Guide to the NEAR Blockchain](https://near.org/blog/the-beginners-guide-to-the-near-blockchain/).

For the rests â€“ overview of the **Near** protocol: [NEAR Protocol ($NEAR)](https://thealpharchives.com/near-protocol-near).

If you havenâ€™t gone through all the links attached to this great article above (*bet 99% you havenâ€™t*), some parts might seem not so clear. Donâ€™t worry, thereâ€™re just 2 important links you need to open. But there is a tiny detailâ€¦ One of these links is exactly the one Iâ€™ve called â€œhugeâ€ earlier. If youâ€™re that crazy person â€“ try your passion and patience by reading these:
[Nightshades](https://near.org/downloads/Nightshade.pdf) (*just to clarify â€“ 37 pages, good luck*);
[Doomslug](https://near.org/blog/doomslug-comparison/) (*much shorter*).
Along with the tons of text, it also provides the illustrations which, imho, are pretty fruitful and worthy of time.

## PART 3 - CONCLUSION

I guess thatâ€™s it. The idea was to provide you with an important base of knowledge of terms, structures and varieties about the blockchain industry. To sum up, careful studying all the materials mentioned above gives us a sufficient understanding of architectures and principles of **Layer 1** & **2 blockchains**, **Smart contracts**, **DApps**, **Rollups**, **Proof-of-work** & **Proof-of-stake mechanisms**. This knowledge will significantly simplify future studying of incredible **Crypto world**.

> Few more notes before leaving.

I already have some plans and ideas for the future articles, so in case you enjoyed reading such stuff, would you mind to subscribe my [twitter](https://twitter.com/macevoycrypto)? Youâ€™ll be notified immediately once itâ€™s ready! Oh, I forgot to give an idea whatâ€™s nextâ€¦ Well, I canâ€™t promise anything, but can give you some hint:

![Kinda a roadmap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9TN1BevBKMzA4-bEBj9E7.png?height=800&width=2000&&&&&&size=medium)

Thanks for your time and sincerely hope you found the whole article useful and valuable. Happy to see any comments & suggestions bellow. See ya soon â¤.

title: Sri Lankan protesters agree to end occupation of official buildings
body: Sri Lankan protesters have agreed to end their occupation of official buildings and will leave their occupied official buildings.

We will start with the leading blockchain, the father of Smart contracts, DeFi and NFT â€“ **ETHEREUM**. Some of you could react as â€œWHAT?! Where the heck is Bitcoin??â€. Iâ€™m not a big fan of Bitcoin, to be honest, and, since the concept of both blockchains is pretty similar (*in relation to **proof-of-work** mechanism; please donâ€™t kill me, I know there is a big difference called **EVM** - **Ethereum Virtual Machine***), I decided to start with that. The amazing article translated into various languages: 
 [How does Ethereum work, anyway?](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-ethereum-work-anyway). 
 (*I recommend to read it in English since improving English skills is our next big goal â€“ more about that later*).

> If you really decided to dive into all of these things, follow the chronology, since I organized that for better understanding of the whole blockchain theory. Terms met in the first articles can be mentioned in the following ones.

Also, itâ€™s quite compatible to watch this video in parallel with the first article:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s)

(*Especially if youâ€™re not familiar at all with **Decentralized finances**, **DApps** & **Smart contracts***).

### 2.2 - COSMOS

Okay, weâ€™ve learnt some basic things about how the amazing technology of blockchain actually works. But you may ask â€œWhat about **proof-of-stake** concept? I heard many blockchains are based on it as on more energy efficient & more scalable analogueâ€ (*or just â€œWhatâ€™s next?â€*). Not a big deal â€“ the whole **validation & delegation** idea is greatly described in the next article about COSMOS ecosystem (*in 2 parts*):
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 1)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-1);  
 [How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 2)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-2).

â€Damn, man, youâ€™re just sending the articles of one particular authorâ€¦ You could send us her link and finish itâ€ â€“ ITâ€™S NOT MY FAULT that her articles are such great for normies. But donâ€™t judge me so fast, here will be more stuff.

### 2.3 - ROLLUPS

As long as weâ€™re aware about the difference between **proof-of-stake** and **proof-of-work** mechanisms, letâ€™s talk about another hot topic â€“ **ZK ROLLUPS**. Thatâ€™s almost impossible you havenâ€™t seen at least some videos or threads about how promising rollups are, determining it as a next huge trend. I guess, thatâ€™s worthy not to put it away: [A normie's guide to rollups](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/a-normies-guide-to-rollups).
And the answer for â€œWhich one is the best finally in that infinite battle?â€ can be found [here](https://medium.com/offchainlabs/optimistic-rollups-the-present-and-future-of-ethereum-scaling-60fb9067ae87) and [here](https://blog.polygon.technology/zk-and-the-future-of-ethereum-scaling/).

**Spoiler:**
.
.
.
Nobody knows exactly.

### 2.4 - Sâ—LANA

Next is **SOLANA**. The killer of Etheâ€¦ Okay, stop it. Nobody kills nobody. I guess weâ€™ve settled that long time ago, heh. We can start with this article giving us an idea of how the Solanaâ€™s **proof-of-history** concept works:
[What Is Solana (SOL)? Learn About Ethereumâ€™s Growing Rival](https://blockworks.co/what-is-solana-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-ethereum-rival/).

Then check out this video:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2)

And read the explanation by Solanaâ€™s founder Anatoly Yakovenko:
[Proof of History: A Clock for Blockchain](https://medium.com/solana-labs/proof-of-history-a-clock-for-blockchain-cf47a61a9274).

Seems more or less clear? I have to admit there are a lot of concerns and humors regarding Solanaâ€™s eligibility and transparency, especially regarding the concept of **proof-of-history**. But letâ€™s leave it for scientists and mathematicians like [Victor Shoup](https://www.shoup.net/papers/poh.pdf) (*You may* *have a look at it, but be careful, it can hurt your brain if youâ€™re not a sort of such guys*).

### 2.5 - NEAR

Letâ€™s dive a little deeper and remind ourselves about **Ethereum 2.0**, its **proof-of-stake** mechanism and, what is the most important, learn about **sharding** technology (*we need it for better understanding of the functionality of our next candidate*). I have to warn you, this part is gonna be more complex comparing to the previous ones:
[Detailed overview of Ethereum 2.0 shard chains: Committees, Proposers and Attesters](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/detailed-overview-of-ethereum-2-0-shard-chains-committees-proposers-and-attesters-a9992d2fd103). (*Well, at least I felt this way*).

> Please note that TxFlow is not relevant at the moment. Itâ€™s still under development and testing, so you can skip it for now.

Great! Iâ€™m feeling how these articles are becoming easier and easier to deal with (*or not, because you just keep scrolling?!*).

![Author when you don't read the article carefully](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ufWQTbVfyKHwNPAGqPXyM.png?height=900&width=1333)

To be honest, I spent several days trying to find similar easy to read material about the **NEAR** Protocol, but either it was huge, either quite complicated. Finally here it is, right after I spent the whole day reading an official doc (*super lucky?*). But first, if youâ€™re not familiar with the Near protocol at all, briefly check this introduction from the official team: [The Beginnerâ€™s Guide to the NEAR Blockchain](https://near.org/blog/the-beginners-guide-to-the-near-blockchain/).

For the rests â€“ overview of the **Near** protocol: [NEAR Protocol ($NEAR)](https://thealpharchives.com/near-protocol-near).

If you havenâ€™t gone through all the links attached to this great article above (*bet 99% you havenâ€™t*), some parts might seem not so clear. Donâ€™t worry, thereâ€™re just 2 important links you need to open. But there is a tiny detailâ€¦ One of these links is exactly the one Iâ€™ve called â€œhugeâ€ earlier. If youâ€™re that crazy person â€“ try your passion and patience by reading these:
[Nightshades](https://near.org/downloads/Nightshade.pdf) (*just to clarify â€“ 37 pages, good luck*);
[Doomslug](https://near.org/blog/doomslug-comparison/) (*much shorter*).
Along with the tons of text, it also provides the illustrations which, imho, are pretty fruitful and worthy of time.

## PART 3 - CONCLUSION

I guess thatâ€™s it. The idea was to provide you with an important base of knowledge of terms, structures and varieties about the blockchain industry. To sum up, careful studying all the materials mentioned above gives us a sufficient understanding of architectures and principles of **Layer 1** & **2 blockchains**, **Smart contracts**, **DApps**, **Rollups**, **Proof-of-work** & **Proof-of-stake mechanisms**. This knowledge will significantly simplify future studying of incredible **Crypto world**.

> Few more notes before leaving.

I already have some plans and ideas for the future articles, so in case you enjoyed reading such stuff, would you mind to subscribe my [twitter](https://twitter.com/macevoycrypto)? Youâ€™ll be notified immediately once itâ€™s ready! Oh, I forgot to give an idea whatâ€™s nextâ€¦ Well, I canâ€™t promise anything, but can give you some hint:

![Kinda a roadmap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9TN1BevBKMzA4-bEBj9E7.png?height=800&width=2000&&&&&&size=medium)

Thanks for your time and sincerely hope you found the whole article useful and valuable. Happy to see any comments & suggestions bellow. See ya soon â¤.

title: Blockchains for Normies
body:
### DESCRIPTION

A first-step guide to raise your knowledge about blockchainsâ€™ architecture. This article is a selection of various materials, including articles and videos, arranged in the chronological order to achieve the highest level of effectiveness in step-by-step learning.

I have to clarify â€“ thatâ€™s NOT a guide for total beginners in crypto. All content mentioned in the article is for those who are aware of the basic terminology & crypto market in general. FYI, the guide is based on my personal experience.

### CONTENTS

**DESCRIPTION
PART 1 - INTRODUCTION
PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS
2\.1 - Ethereum
2\.2 - Cosmos
2\.3 - Rollups
2\.4 - Solana
2\.5 - Near
PART 3 - CONCLUSION**

> Hey, thanks for checking out! If you donâ€™t like author to be talkative, just skip the introduction and jump directly to **PART 2**.

## PART 1 - INTRODUCTION

Lately, Iâ€™ve heard a lot of similar opinions like â€œThatâ€™s the best time to prepare yourself for the next bull marketâ€ or â€œGet out of charts and do some education insteadâ€. If you actively participated in all the â€œdegenâ€ plays with tokens and NFTs, or were busy as a day-trader for a while, Iâ€™d presume there wasnâ€™t enough time for such a silly thing as an **Education**. But isnâ€™t that finally a perfect time as people keep telling us? What if we shift our focus to learn something fundamental? Of course, Itâ€™s always nice to earn money by investing or speculating on one or another asset. Especially, when we saw such a great performance of most of the projects and especially blockchains in 2021.

![ATOM/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8eJdnSpY41ZFz7qR1dRUx.png?height=1189&width=1813)

![SOL/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zftEaJUKtu7syUpofERTE.png?height=1190&width=1820)

And Iâ€™m sure many of you got extremely good profits along with that rise. But here are few questions â€œ**Were you aware that LUNAâ€™s death loop is inevitable? Did you try to buy this dip?â€.** I have a feeling there are some, at least, who were not and tried so (*either was I*). Letâ€™s not make the same mistakes again. Without further more (*I know you may get tired of a long introduction*) letâ€™s jump into what I prepared for you.

## PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS

So, education, huh? What can we start with? Iâ€™ve been thinking and perceived to start with just fundamental things â€“ **Blockchains** and **Ecosystems**. If youâ€™re interested in boosting your knowledge about blockchains and crypto in general, below youâ€™ll find a selection of the related articles/videos. I found them extremely useful and perfectly fit for non-tech guys or â€œnormiesâ€.

> I have to clarify that the author is aware about whitepapers and other official resources, and that it is the best way to get familiar with functionality of blockchains and crypto protocols. But since the topic of this article is â€œ**Blockchains for Normies**â€, I prepared a selection of easy to understand materials to form a basic knowledge of structure and understanding of various tech aspects.

### 2.1 - ÎTHEREUM

We will start with the leading blockchain, the father of Smart contracts, DeFi and NFT â€“ **ETHEREUM**. Some of you could react as â€œWHAT?! Where the heck is Bitcoin??â€. Iâ€™m not a big fan of Bitcoin, to be honest, and, since the concept of both blockchains is pretty similar (*in relation to **proof-of-work** mechanism; please donâ€™t kill me, I know there is a big difference called **EVM** - **Ethereum Virtual Machine***), I decided to start with that. The amazing article translated into various languages: 
 [How does Ethereum work, anyway?](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-ethereum-work-anyway). 
 (*I recommend to read it in English since improving English skills is our next big goal â€“ more about that later*).

> If you really decided to dive into all of these things, follow the chronology, since I organized that for better understanding of the whole blockchain theory. Terms met in the first articles can be mentioned in the following ones.

Also, itâ€™s quite compatible to watch this video in parallel with the first article:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s)

(*Especially if youâ€™re not familiar at all with **Decentralized finances**, **DApps** & **Smart contracts***).

### 2.2 - COSMOS

Okay, weâ€™ve learnt some basic things about how the amazing technology of blockchain actually works. But you may ask â€œWhat about **proof-of-stake** concept? I heard many blockchains are based on it as on more energy efficient & more scalable analogueâ€ (*or just â€œWhatâ€™s next?â€*). Not a big deal â€“ the whole **validation & delegation** idea is greatly described in the next article about COSMOS ecosystem (*in 2 parts*):
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 1)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-1);  
 [How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 2)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-2).

â€Damn, man, youâ€™re just sending the articles of one particular authorâ€¦ You could send us her link and finish itâ€ â€“ ITâ€™S NOT MY FAULT that her articles are such great for normies. But donâ€™t judge me so fast, here will be more stuff.

### 2.3 - ROLLUPS

As long as weâ€™re aware about the difference between **proof-of-stake** and **proof-of-work** mechanisms, letâ€™s talk about another hot topic â€“ **ZK ROLLUPS**. Thatâ€™s almost impossible you havenâ€™t seen at least some videos or threads about how promising rollups are, determining it as a next huge trend. I guess, thatâ€™s worthy not to put it away: [A normie's guide to rollups](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/a-normies-guide-to-rollups).
And the answer for â€œWhich one is the best finally in that infinite battle?â€ can be found [here](https://medium.com/offchainlabs/optimistic-rollups-the-present-and-future-of-ethereum-scaling-60fb9067ae87) and [here](https://blog.polygon.technology/zk-and-the-future-of-ethereum-scaling/).

**Spoiler:**
.
.
.
Nobody knows exactly.

### 2.4 - Sâ—LANA

Next is **SOLANA**. The killer of Etheâ€¦ Okay, stop it. Nobody kills nobody. I guess weâ€™ve settled that long time ago, heh. We can start with this article giving us an idea of how the Solanaâ€™s **proof-of-history** concept works:
[What Is Solana (SOL)? Learn About Ethereumâ€™s Growing Rival](https://blockworks.co/what-is-solana-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-ethereum-rival/).

Then check out this video:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2)

And read the explanation by Solanaâ€™s founder Anatoly Yakovenko:
[Proof of History: A Clock for Blockchain](https://medium.com/solana-labs/proof-of-history-a-clock-for-blockchain-cf47a61a9274).

Seems more or less clear? I have to admit there are a lot of concerns and humors regarding Solanaâ€™s eligibility and transparency, especially regarding the concept of **proof-of-history**. But letâ€™s leave it for scientists and mathematicians like [Victor Shoup](https://www.shoup.net/papers/poh.pdf) (*You may* *have a look at it, but be careful, it can hurt your brain if youâ€™re not a sort of such guys*).

### 2.5 - NEAR

Letâ€™s dive a little deeper and remind ourselves about **Ethereum 2.0**, its **proof-of-stake** mechanism and, what is the most important, learn about **sharding** technology (*we need it for better understanding of the functionality of our next candidate*). I have to warn you, this part is gonna be more complex comparing to the previous ones:
[Detailed overview of Ethereum 2.0 shard chains: Committees, Proposers and Attesters](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/detailed-overview-of-ethereum-2-0-shard-chains-committees-proposers-and-attesters-a9992d2fd103). (*Well, at least I felt this way*).

> Please note that TxFlow is not relevant at the moment. Itâ€™s still under development and testing, so you can skip it for now.

Great! Iâ€™m feeling how these articles are becoming easier and easier to deal with (*or not, because you just keep scrolling?!*).

![Author when you don't read the article carefully](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ufWQTbVfyKHwNPAGqPXyM.png?height=900&width=1333)

To be honest, I spent several days trying to find similar easy to read material about the **NEAR** Protocol, but either it was huge, either quite complicated. Finally here it is, right after I spent the whole day reading an official doc (*super lucky?*). But first, if youâ€™re not familiar with the Near protocol at all, briefly check this introduction from the official team: [The Beginnerâ€™s Guide to the NEAR Blockchain](https://near.org/blog/the-beginners-guide-to-the-near-blockchain/).

For the rests â€“ overview of the **Near** protocol: [NEAR Protocol ($NEAR)](https://thealpharchives.com/near-protocol-near).

If you havenâ€™t gone through all the links attached to this great article above (*bet 99% you havenâ€™t*), some parts might seem not so clear. Donâ€™t worry, thereâ€™re just 2 important links you need to open. But there is a tiny detailâ€¦ One of these links is exactly the one Iâ€™ve called â€œhugeâ€ earlier. If youâ€™re that crazy person â€“ try your passion and patience by reading these:
[Nightshades](https://near.org/downloads/Nightshade.pdf) (*just to clarify â€“ 37 pages, good luck*);
[Doomslug](https://near.org/blog/doomslug-comparison/) (*much shorter*).
Along with the tons of text, it also provides the illustrations which, imho, are pretty fruitful and worthy of time.

## PART 3 - CONCLUSION

I guess thatâ€™s it. The idea was to provide you with an important base of knowledge of terms, structures and varieties about the blockchain industry. To sum up, careful studying all the materials mentioned above gives us a sufficient understanding of architectures and principles of **Layer 1** & **2 blockchains**, **Smart contracts**, **DApps**, **Rollups**, **Proof-of-work** & **Proof-of-stake mechanisms**. This knowledge will significantly simplify future studying of incredible **Crypto world**.

> Few more notes before leaving.

I already have some plans and ideas for the future articles, so in case you enjoyed reading such stuff, would you mind to subscribe my [twitter](https://twitter.com/macevoycrypto)? Youâ€™ll be notified immediately once itâ€™s ready! Oh, I forgot to give an idea whatâ€™s nextâ€¦ Well, I canâ€™t promise anything, but can give you some hint:

![Kinda a roadmap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9TN1BevBKMzA4-bEBj9E7.png?height=800&width=2000&&&&&&size=medium)

Thanks for your time and sincerely hope you found the whole article useful and valuable. Happy to see any comments & suggestions. See ya soon â¤.

Ğ”ĞµĞ»Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ğ±ĞµÑĞ¿ĞµÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° ÑĞ¼Ğ¸ÑÑĞ¸Ñ, Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°ĞµĞ¼ **Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½ÑƒÑ Ñ†ĞµĞ½Ñƒ** (Ğ¾Ğ±ĞµÑĞ¿ĞµÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ñ†ĞµĞ½Ñƒ). ### Ğ•ÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°ĞµĞ¼

title: Spot The Alpha: A Comparison of Recent Free Mint Collections
body:
Recently there has been a trend of free mint NFT collections and some of them have excelled by a huge margin. Some famous free mints include Goblintown, We Are All Going To Die, and Ill Poop It. Now let's look at their historical peak floor price.

## Key Takeaways

1. A high-demand free mint will be minted out in a very short period of time, making the majority of NFT buyers only able to purchase on the secondary market.
2. A good free mint will have a high ratio of only minting 1 NFT per wallet to avoid manipulation.
3. The survival of projects that have free mints will depend highly on their trading volume post mint.
4. Free mint NFTs that started with large volume post mint are not likely to go further as more speculators and traders are trying to take some profits.

### Latest Free Mint Collection and Their Peak Floor Price

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/v8soPmBN8UqpmRvFWr8DJ.png?height=900&width=1600)

We can see the outlier is Goblintown, which reached above 7 ETH in the past month. This is amazing considering the mint cost is 0 ETH. Some other NFT collections that reached above 1 ETH including Killabear, We Are All Going To Die, Ill Poop It NFT, and God Hates NFTees, and WZRDS. Others that have yet to surpass a 1 ETH floor include For The Culture, and Moonrunners.

What makes them different from each other? How do we spot the next trending free mint NFTs? To understand the whole process of free minting, we will need to analyze the period of the minting phase. 

### Latest Free Mint Collection Stats During Minting Phase

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/juEwmd9LjQ4p8JfBlW1xt.png?height=900&width=1600)

We break down the first 12 hours of the minting phase of these free mint collections, as it is one of the most crucial phases in determining if an NFT collection is in high demand. The 2 largeset spikes on the chart are from We Are All Going To Die and Goblintown, which minted out in less than an hour. Noticed how Goblintown minted out quick, in the 5th hour of minting, rather than being fully minted out in the first hour. The next one is We Are All Going To Die. It minted out in the second hour of the minting phase.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8S_8O494-rp_qkX0648WL.png?height=900&width=1600)

Next, we look at the ratio of how many wallets only minted 1 free NFT of each collection. Other than Moonrunners, Ill Poop It, and Killabear, the rest had over 90% of minters with only 1 NFT minted free. This guarantees a fair distribution in each wallet and reduces the risk of manipulation by certain groups of NFT traders. What comes next is also crucial in the survival of the free mint NFT collections.

## Free Mint NFT Collection Post Mint Stats

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nJg2F1FD1rP1t633IYHHj.png?height=900&width=1600)

After the minting phase, NFT buyers can only purchase those NFTs on the secondary market. The graph above shows the volume in the first 48 hours, post-minting phase. There are 3 spikes of volume that are worth noting. The first spike happened in the first 8 hours of the WZRDS and We Are All Going To Die. The second spike is during 16-28 hours post mint of the same collection, We Are All Going To Die. The last spike observed is from Goblintown NFT. Recall only Goblintown survived and went above 2 ETH compared to the rest of the free mint NFT collections. What can we learn from this chart? Those collections that started with large volume slowly decayed and the floor went underwater.

From the Holder Trends for Goblintown, we are able to see Whale Holders are slowly increasing instead of a huge spike, compared to We Are All Going To Die. The Whale Holders in We Are All Going To Die NFT dropped from the top and decrease rapidly.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1M5Rh_2WbX1Rcc5uqRIcd.png?height=900&width=1600)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ergQdkvdC4HJoxAQRnG1D.png?height=900&width=1600)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/EOs42xmSqZxlMNS70Wt7D.png?height=900&width=1600)

The chart above shows the historical average sale price in the first 48 hours after the minting phase. We Are All Going To Die NFT rose very quickly to more than 1 ETH compared to the rest in the first 48 hours, but it also decays very quickly. Observe that Goblintown NFT works exactly opposite to We Are All Going To Die. It started slowly in the first 24 hours and then began its momentum and sustained along the way to 2 ETH and above.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/maYoVTgEiEPaFLxANexFg.png?height=900&width=1600)

One of the reasons We Are All Going To Die rose quickly is because it launched after Goblintown. Buyers and traders are FOMO-ing into the next free mint project hoping it will go as far as Goblintown. However, too many users FOMO'd into We Are All Going To Die, causing it to be unsustainable as degens are just trading rather than holding. This is also the case for WZRDS. WZRDS launched after We Are All Going To Die NFT as free mint and the huge volume in the first 8 hours after minting is overwhelming. The volume for WZRDS is decaying super quickly and now has no volume for it causing its floor price to stay the same.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cLAFWjEKIGgvqsixJRjRM.png?height=900&width=1600)

In the first 48 hours post-mint, Goblintown is sitting at the top with the highest number of unique buyers and sellers. The number of unique sellers are more than the number of unique buyers for almost all free mint NFT collections. This is significant as it shows strong demand for the NFT collection and that plenty of users are interested in it. Other than that, we also observed a similar number of unique buyers and sellers for Moonrunners, We Are All Going To Die, Ill Poop It, and WZRDS.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lWKQVR57Pu1TU6vP3B6ZL.png?height=900&width=1600)

Daily Max Price also gives us a hint about the strong demand of an NFT collection. In the first 48 hours, we can see the majority of outliers came from We Are All Going To Die and Goblintown. An extreme outlier is needed for the collection to go above and be sustainable.

## Conclusion on the Latest Free-Mint Collections

Free mint NFTs are a new way to open up to new communities as it cost 0 ETH to join. A better free mint NFT collection needs to be over-delivered and under-promised. This will make the minters become hodlers and make it sustainable. Nevertheless, free mint means the NFT is free of cost, and users will constantly take a profit and sell it. One way to prevent getting undercut is through more research and analysis of the stats during minting and during the first few days after minting.

Note: The above information is for informational purposes only. Investing in digital assets such as NFTs and cryptocurrency brings with it a high degree of risk. Please consult with a financial advisor before making any investment decisions. NFTGo.io does not provide financial advice and is not responsible for any losses incurred as a result of investing in digital assets.

title: Blockchains for Normies
body:
### DESCRIPTION

A first-step guide to raise your knowledge about blockchainsâ€™ architecture. This article is a selection of various materials, including articles and videos, arranged in the chronological order to achieve the highest level of effectiveness in step-by-step learning.

I have to clarify â€“ thatâ€™s NOT a guide for total beginners in crypto. All content mentioned in the article is for those who are aware of the basic terminology & crypto market in general. FYI, the guide is based on my personal experience.

### CONTENTS

**DESCRIPTION
PART 1 - INTRODUCTION
PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS
2\.1 - Ethereum
2\.2 - Cosmos
2\.3 - Rollups
2\.4 - Solana
2\.5 - Near
PART 3 - CONCLUSION**

> Hey, thanks for checking out! If you donâ€™t like author to be talkative, just skip the introduction and jump directly to **PART 2**.

## PART 1 - INTRODUCTION

Lately, Iâ€™ve heard a lot of similar opinions like â€œThatâ€™s the best time to prepare yourself for the next bull marketâ€ or â€œGet out of charts and do some education insteadâ€. If you actively participated in all the â€œdegenâ€ plays with tokens and NFTs, or were busy as a day-trader for a while, Iâ€™d presume there wasnâ€™t enough time for such a silly thing as an **Education**. But isnâ€™t that finally a perfect time as people keep telling us? What if we shift our focus to learn something fundamental? Of course, Itâ€™s always nice to earn money by investing or speculating on one or another asset. Especially, when we saw such a great performance of most of the projects and especially blockchains in 2021.

![ATOM/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8eJdnSpY41ZFz7qR1dRUx.png?height=1189&width=1813)

![SOL/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zftEaJUKtu7syUpofERTE.png?height=1190&width=1820)

And Iâ€™m sure many of you got extremely good profits along with that rise. But here are few questions â€œ**Were you aware that LUNAâ€™s death loop is inevitable? Did you try to buy this dip?â€.** I have a feeling there are some, at least, who were not and tried so (*either was I*). Letâ€™s not make the same mistakes again. Without further more (*I know you may get tired of a long introduction*) letâ€™s jump into what I prepared for you.

## PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS

So, education, huh? What can we start with? Iâ€™ve been thinking and perceived to start with just fundamental things â€“ **Blockchains** and **Ecosystems**. If youâ€™re interested in boosting your knowledge about blockchains and crypto in general, below youâ€™ll find a selection of the related articles/videos. I found them extremely useful and perfectly fit for non-tech guys or â€œnormiesâ€.

> I have to clarify that the author is aware about whitepapers and other official resources, and that it is the best way to get familiar with functionality of blockchains and crypto protocols. But since the topic of this article is â€œ**Blockchains for Normies**â€, I prepared a selection of easy to understand materials to form a basic knowledge of structure and understanding of various tech aspects.

### 2.1 - ÎTHEREUM

We will start with the leading blockchain, the father of Smart contracts, DeFi and NFT â€“ **ETHEREUM**. Some of you could react as â€œWHAT?! Where the heck is Bitcoin??â€. Iâ€™m not a big fan of Bitcoin, to be honest, and, since the concept of both blockchains is pretty similar (*in relation to **proof-of-work** mechanism; please donâ€™t kill me, I know there is a big difference called **EVM** - **Ethereum Virtual Machine***), I decided to start with that. The amazing article translated into various languages:
[How does Ethereum work, anyway?](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-ethereum-work-anyway).
(*I recommend to read it in English since improving English skills is our next big goal â€“ more about that later*).

> If you really decided to dive into all of these things, follow the chronology, since I organized that for better understanding of the whole blockchain theory. Terms met in the first articles can be mentioned in the following ones.

Also, itâ€™s quite compatible to watch this video in parallel with the first article:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s)

(*Especially if youâ€™re not familiar at all with **Decentralized finances**, **DApps** & **Smart contracts***).

### 2.2 - COSMOS

Okay, weâ€™ve learnt some basic things about how the amazing technology of blockchain actually works. But you may ask â€œWhat about **proof-of-stake** concept? I heard many blockchains are based on it as on more energy efficient & more scalable analogueâ€ (*or just â€œWhatâ€™s next?â€*). Not a big deal â€“ the whole **validation & delegation** idea is greatly described in the next article about COSMOS ecosystem (*in 2 parts*):
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 1)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-1);[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 2)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-2).

â€Damn, man, youâ€™re just sending the articles of one particular authorâ€¦ You could send us her link and finish itâ€ â€“ ITâ€™S NOT MY FAULT that her articles are such great for normies. But donâ€™t judge me so fast, here will be more stuff.

### 2.3 - ROLLUPS

As long as weâ€™re aware about the difference between **proof-of-stake** and **proof-of-work** mechanisms, letâ€™s talk about another hot topic â€“ **ZK ROLLUPS**. Thatâ€™s almost impossible you havenâ€™t seen at least some videos or threads about how promising rollups are, determining it as a next huge trend. I guess, thatâ€™s worthy not to put it away: [A normie's guide to rollups](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/a-normies-guide-to-rollups).
And the answer for â€œWhich one is the best finally in that infinite battle?â€ can be found [here](https://medium.com/offchainlabs/optimistic-rollups-the-present-and-future-of-ethereum-scaling-60fb9067ae87) and [here](https://blog.polygon.technology/zk-and-the-future-of-ethereum-scaling/).

**Spoiler:**
.
.
.
Nobody knows exactly.

### 2.4 - Sâ—LANA

Next is **SOLANA**. The killer of Etheâ€¦ Okay, stop it. Nobody kills nobody. I guess weâ€™ve settled that long time ago, heh. We can start with this article giving us an idea of how the Solanaâ€™s **proof-of-history** concept works:
[What Is Solana (SOL)? Learn About Ethereumâ€™s Growing Rival](https://blockworks.co/what-is-solana-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-ethereum-rival/).

Then check out this video:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2)

And read the explanation by Solanaâ€™s founder Anatoly Yakovenko:
[Proof of History: A Clock for Blockchain](https://medium.com/solana-labs/proof-of-history-a-clock-for-blockchain-cf47a61a9274).

Seems more or less clear? I have to admit there are a lot of concerns and humors regarding Solanaâ€™s eligibility and transparency, especially regarding the concept of **proof-of-history**. But letâ€™s leave it for scientists and mathematicians like [Victor Shoup](https://www.shoup.net/papers/poh.pdf) (*You may* *have a look at it, but be careful, it can hurt your brain if youâ€™re not a sort of such guys*).

### 2.5 - NEAR

Letâ€™s dive a little deeper and remind ourselves about **Ethereum 2.0**, its **proof-of-stake** mechanism and, what is the most important, learn about **sharding** technology (*we need it for better understanding of the functionality of our next candidate*). I have to warn you, this part is gonna be more complex comparing to the previous ones:
[Detailed overview of Ethereum 2.0 shard chains: Committees, Proposers and Attesters](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/detailed-overview-of-ethereum-2-0-shard-chains-committees-proposers-and-attesters-a9992d2fd103). (*Well, at least I felt this way*).

> Please note that TxFlow is not relevant at the moment. Itâ€™s still under development and testing, so you can skip it for now.

Great! Iâ€™m feeling how these articles are becoming easier and easier to deal with (*or not, because you just keep scrolling?!*).

![Author when you don't read the article carefully](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ufWQTbVfyKHwNPAGqPXyM.png?height=900&width=1333)

To be honest, I spent several days trying to find similar easy to read material about the **NEAR** Protocol, but either it was huge, either quite complicated. Finally here it is, right after I spent the whole day reading an official doc (*super lucky?*). But first, if youâ€™re not familiar with the Near protocol at all, briefly check this introduction from the official team: [The Beginnerâ€™s Guide to the NEAR Blockchain](https://near.org/blog/the-beginners-guide-to-the-near-blockchain/).

For the rests â€“ overview of the **Near** protocol: [NEAR Protocol ($NEAR)](https://thealpharchives.com/near-protocol-near).

If you havenâ€™t gone through all the links attached to this great article above (*bet 99% you havenâ€™t*), some parts might seem not so clear. Donâ€™t worry, thereâ€™re just 2 important links you need to open. But there is a tiny detailâ€¦ One of these links is exactly the one Iâ€™ve called â€œhugeâ€ earlier. If youâ€™re that crazy person â€“ try your passion and patience by reading these:
[Nightshades](https://near.org/downloads/Nightshade.pdf) (*just to clarify â€“ 37 pages, good luck*);
[Doomslug](https://near.org/blog/doomslug-comparison/) (*much shorter*).
Along with the tons of text, it also provides the illustrations which, imho, are pretty fruitful and worthy of time.

## PART 3 - CONCLUSION

I guess thatâ€™s it. The idea was to provide you with an important base of knowledge of terms, structures and varieties about the blockchain industry. To sum up, careful studying all the materials mentioned above gives us a sufficient understanding of architectures and principles of **Layer 1** & **2 blockchains**, **Smart contracts**, **DApps**, **Rollups**, **Proof-of-work** & **Proof-of-stake mechanisms**. This knowledge will significantly simplify future studying of incredible **Crypto world**.

> Few more notes before leaving.

I already have some plans and ideas for the future articles, so in case you enjoyed reading such stuff, would you mind to subscribe my [twitter](https://twitter.com/macevoy_eth)? Youâ€™ll be notified immediately once itâ€™s ready! Oh, I forgot to give an idea whatâ€™s nextâ€¦ Well, I canâ€™t promise anything, but can give you some hint:

![Kinda a roadmap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9TN1BevBKMzA4-bEBj9E7.png?height=800&width=2000&&&&&&&size=medium)

Thanks for your time and sincerely hope you found the whole article useful and valuable. Happy to see any comments & suggestions. See ya soon â¤.

title: Spot The Alpha: A Comparison of Recent Free Mint Collections
body:
Recently there has been a trend of free mint NFT collections and some of them have excelled by a huge margin. Some famous free mints include Goblintown, We Are All Going To Die, and Ill Poop It. Now let's look at their historical peak floor price.

## Key Takeaways

1. A high-demand free mint will be minted out in a very short period of time, making the majority of NFT buyers only able to purchase on the secondary market.
2. A good free mint will have a high ratio of only minting 1 NFT per wallet to avoid manipulation.
3. The survival of projects that have free mints will depend highly on their trading volume post mint.
4. Free mint NFTs that started with large volume post mint are not likely to go further as more speculators and traders are trying to take some profits.

### Latest Free Mint Collection and Their Peak Floor Price

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/v8soPmBN8UqpmRvFWr8DJ.png?height=900&width=1600)

We can see the outlier is Goblintown, which reached above 7 ETH in the past month. This is amazing considering the mint cost is 0 ETH. Some other NFT collections that reached above 1 ETH including Killabear, We Are All Going To Die, Ill Poop It NFT, and God Hates NFTees, and WZRDS. Others that have yet to surpass a 1 ETH floor include For The Culture, and Moonrunners.

What makes them different from each other? How do we spot the next trending free mint NFTs? To understand the whole process of free minting, we will need to analyze the period of the minting phase. 

### Latest Free Mint Collection Stats During Minting Phase

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/juEwmd9LjQ4p8JfBlW1xt.png?height=900&width=1600)

We break down the first 12 hours of the minting phase of these free mint collections, as it is one of the most crucial phases in determining if an NFT collection is in high demand. The 2 largeset spikes on the chart are from We Are All Going To Die and Goblintown, which minted out in less than an hour. Noticed how Goblintown minted out quick, in the 5th hour of minting, rather than being fully minted out in the first hour. The next one is We Are All Going To Die. It minted out in the second hour of the minting phase.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8S_8O494-rp_qkX0648WL.png?height=900&width=1600)

Next, we look at the ratio of how many wallets only minted 1 free NFT of each collection. Other than Moonrunners, Ill Poop It, and Killabear, the rest had over 90% of minters with only 1 NFT minted free. This guarantees a fair distribution in each wallet and reduces the risk of manipulation by certain groups of NFT traders. What comes next is also crucial in the survival of the free mint NFT collections.

## Free Mint NFT Collection Post Mint Stats

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nJg2F1FD1rP1t633IYHHj.png?height=900&width=1600)

After the minting phase, NFT buyers can only purchase those NFTs on the secondary market. The graph above shows the volume in the first 48 hours, post-minting phase. There are 3 spikes of volume that are worth noting. The first spike happened in the first 8 hours of the WZRDS and We Are All Going To Die. The second spike is during 16-28 hours post mint of the same collection, We Are All Going To Die. The last spike observed is from Goblintown NFT. Recall only Goblintown survived and went above 2 ETH compared to the rest of the free mint NFT collections. What can we learn from this chart? Those collections that started with large volume slowly decayed and the floor went underwater.

From the Holder Trends for Goblintown, we are able to see Whale Holders are slowly increasing instead of a huge spike, compared to We Are All Going To Die. The Whale Holders in We Are All Going To Die NFT dropped from the top and decrease rapidly.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1M5Rh_2WbX1Rcc5uqRIcd.png?height=900&width=1600)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ergQdkvdC4HJoxAQRnG1D.png?height=900&width=1600)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/EOs42xmSqZxlMNS70Wt7D.png?height=900&width=1600)

The chart above shows the historical average sale price in the first 48 hours after the minting phase. We Are All Going To Die NFT rose very quickly to more than 1 ETH compared to the rest in the first 48 hours, but it also decays very quickly. Observe that Goblintown NFT works exactly opposite to We Are All Going To Die. It started slowly in the first 24 hours and then began its momentum and sustained along the way to 2 ETH and above.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/maYoVTgEiEPaFLxANexFg.png?height=900&width=1600)

One of the reasons We Are All Going To Die rose quickly is because it launched after Goblintown. Buyers and traders are FOMO-ing into the next free mint project hoping it will go as far as Goblintown. However, too many users FOMO'd into We Are All Going To Die, causing it to be unsustainable as degens are just trading rather than holding. This is also the case for WZRDS. WZRDS launched after We Are All Going To Die NFT as free mint and the huge volume in the first 8 hours after minting is overwhelming. The volume for WZRDS is decaying super quickly and now has no volume for it causing its floor price to stay the same.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cLAFWjEKIGgvqsixJRjRM.png?height=900&width=1600)

In the first 48 hours post-mint, Goblintown is sitting at the top with the highest number of unique buyers and sellers. The number of unique sellers are more than the number of unique buyers for almost all free mint NFT collections. This is significant as it shows strong demand for the NFT collection and that plenty of users are interested in it. Other than that, we also observed a similar number of unique buyers and sellers for Moonrunners, We Are All Going To Die, Ill Poop It, and WZRDS.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lWKQVR57Pu1TU6vP3B6ZL.png?height=900&width=1600)

Daily Max Price also gives us a hint about the strong demand of an NFT collection. In the first 48 hours, we can see the majority of outliers came from We Are All Going To Die and Goblintown. An extreme outlier is needed for the collection to go above and be sustainable.

## Conclusion on the Latest Free-Mint Collections

Free mint NFTs are a new way to open up to new communities as it cost 0 ETH to join. A better free mint NFT collection needs to be over-delivered and under-promised. This will make the minters become hodlers and make it sustainable. Nevertheless, free mint means the NFT is free of cost, and users will constantly take a profit and sell it. One way to prevent getting undercut is through more research and analysis of the stats during minting and during the first few days after minting.

Note: The above information is for informational purposes only. Investing in digital assets such as NFTs and cryptocurrency brings with it a high degree of risk. Please consult with a financial advisor before making any investment decisions. NFTGo.io does not provide financial advice and is not responsible for any losses incurred as a result of investing in digital assets.

title: Welcome Collaborators
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZEDocPNQ6Yj5nXioP3cP5.png?height=432&width=1364)

**Mundo Lingo Collaborators** govern and participate in Mundo Lingoâ€™s future (as detailed in **[Decentralise Mundo Lingo](https://mirror.xyz/0xe2A039aB83dB1ea76842FEc23611806d50C4B4Ae/Bz8plTeNzVaYGOvJ7utPNUn41k6G4HSh3fnhOxzWjb8)**) from avid fans to community leaders, designers, photographers, Devs, and even host venues and language schools.

## ğŸ¡ Move in with us

**You can** be part of this house even if you donâ€™t have a specific skill to offer. If you care for the project, youâ€™ll fit in just fine. While some tasks require skills, others are very open such as voting, helping moderate our chats, helping out at IRL events, or giving your opinion.

## ğŸš€ Initiation

**Visit** - **[Mundo Lingo Collaborators](https://t.me/Join_Collaborators)** (Telegram) and follow the steps below.

## ğŸ‘‹ Self-Introduce

This is a **must**. Be noticed - Light up the sky ğŸŒŸ

![ ğŸŒŸdonâ€™t let anyone not-notice you arrived âœ¨](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5HIiP9XBfThdyev6OMU4A.png?height=352&width=1013)

* Hash tag your skills + interests (if any)- EG.\* `#bizdev, #CSS, #illustration, #callhosting, #leadership, #twitter`
* Who are you?
* What are your passions, hobbies, interests?
* How did you get here?
* Why are you here?
* What are you interested in?
* Who are you interested in connecting with?
* What skills -if any- can you offer to other members?

### Pro-Tips

* Itâ€™s okay to observe the group, but try to make an intro within 5 days.
* Use a nice photo and a real name to get a warmer reception.
* Respond to other peopleâ€™s intros! ğŸ‘‹

## Attend a Scrum

Before getting into residency, why not join us on a general call? Youâ€™re not obligated to speak, you can just watch.

## Do something on the #WeNeed List

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/peUevJDqMgVmRIzn6-yqW.png?height=267&width=768)

1. Check #WeNeed in the group
2. Find a task that you like
3. Raise a ğŸ‘‹ and let people know youâ€™re doing it

## âš¡ï¸ Propose

So you want to change something? Itâ€™s your community, change it.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bUoH7qExF6DgyItfWy5xy.png?height=567&width=1800)

1. Open your city on **[mundolingo.org](https://mundolingo.org)**
2. Add **(mundolingo)** + other relevant Networks
3. Select Proposeâ€¦ and Propose!

## ğŸ„ Level Up 

Apply for residency (if you want to) according to your area of interest using the links below

**Remote Teams**

* **[Online Assembly](https://mirror.xyz/0xe2A039aB83dB1ea76842FEc23611806d50C4B4Ae/YHiCb5_XaYGdpbRypQWQkl09ptcQ-gQ4z3xVB_ChbDc)** - (Online Admins)
* **[The Dark Room](https://mirror.xyz/0xe2A039aB83dB1ea76842FEc23611806d50C4B4Ae/mMsMcopOXI0bNouEsFfzIW335FmcSaBZGPtNoeFuTJg)** - (Photographers)
* **[Q-Branch](https://mirror.xyz/0xe2A039aB83dB1ea76842FEc23611806d50C4B4Ae/abZEekjoqgKeGgTy1ONPW7H6ZJuHu4nCgN_rw9yvwMM)** (Web Dev + Tech)
* **Lingo Studios** - (Design and Illustration)
* **[The News Room](https://mirror.xyz/0xe2A039aB83dB1ea76842FEc23611806d50C4B4Ae/r-jCVCR5kfJAUN_LmmBR8OArQjezFHD6m0dgCqkTR3M)** - (Social Media)
* **Venue Investigation Bureau** - (Finding / verifying venues)

**IRL Teams**

* **[The ](https://mirror.xyz/0xe2A039aB83dB1ea76842FEc23611806d50C4B4Ae/u9k391Q69s4h51bqyDa5GDeG7HurDVXaOuhFcHcb-Jc%C3%A7)[Academy](https://mirror.xyz/0xe2A039aB83dB1ea76842FEc23611806d50C4B4Ae/u9k391Q69s4h51bqyDa5GDeG7HurDVXaOuhFcHcb-Jc)** (Manager Academy)
* **[Embassies](https://mirror.xyz/0xe2A039aB83dB1ea76842FEc23611806d50C4B4Ae/GUZj246f3hBt927EWv_XtirgExr-3Xm97nI8nak8BY0)** (Local City Teams)


---

### Managers

This is a high level of commitment role. More on that **[hereâ€¦](https://mirror.xyz/0x9aDe01ED938E536CfBD5eA5cC21b62Ba65Ce2da2/2BqZzS5xZgDQ-PX7vg7moqJUe1zJPvZHbq8SmFIAhIA)**

If youâ€™re up for it, [apply here](https://form.typeform.com/to/G1bjAQ?typeform-source=mundolingo.org).

### Ambassadors

This requires physical presence in the events. Ambassadors arrive early to ensure the well-being of the public during the event

### Photographers

Photographers are huge for us. We like to find photographers who are naturally talented and yet lacking experience especially indoor settings. We provide resources, guidance and a strong community to help photographer progress quickly. More on that [hereâ€¦](https://mirror.xyz/0xe2A039aB83dB1ea76842FEc23611806d50C4B4Ae/mMsMcopOXI0bNouEsFfzIW335FmcSaBZGPtNoeFuTJg)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JrP4nKwbm0dv7jD_k51o4.png?height=319&width=1482)

## Types of Collaborators

### Lurkers

**Lurkers** hang out not saying much and generally observing the group. Thatâ€™s fine but try to participate, vote and offer useful perspective occasionally when you can.

### Residents

Residents have leveled up into a **team (see list above)**. Volunteer from time to time to help with crowd-tasking. For example, group admins, Ambassadors, or to help verify some venues. When you volunteer youâ€™ll be given a task that may take anything from 10 minutes to a couple of hours depending on various factors. These tasks may be random, or they can involve your special skill set.

### Leads

For Crowd-Tasking projects we have small specialised working groups. Each is headed by a **Lead** with a strong grasp of the tasks at hand.

title: Next.ID Aggregates Identities Across Web2 and Web3, Giving Data Ownership Back To Users
body:
## Next.ID: The worldâ€™s first Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS)

[Next.ID](https://next.id/), the worldâ€™s first protocol offering Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS) is moving into beta testing. It is a decentralized identity aggregation protocol that integrates all Web2 and Web3 digital identities, offering a comprehensive and verifiable identity database for open-source developers and projects to innovate and build dApps on.

As the worldâ€™s first DIaaS, Next.ID creates an identity infrastructure that securely aggregates usersâ€™ identities into Avatars, making it the primary touch point for interfacing with any app or dApp.

![Next.ID's role in the ecosystem](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iOytcopPQvTOgd0KOdQ2h.png?height=788&width=1400)

Next.IDâ€™s Avatars exist independently from Web2 and Web3, using a blockchain-like model to retain data integrity. This allows Next.ID to connect to all Web2 and Web3 platforms, aggregating all identities in a fully-agnostic way, unifying them into one single decentralized identifier (DID).

Welcome to the future of Digital Identity.

## The most seamless DID aggregator for Web3 builders

* The ideal DIaaS System must be built with an architecture that prioritizes identity safety and data privacy
* A universal Digital Identity management system must consolidate identifiers across chains and platforms in both Web2 & Web3 so identity data can be useful and meaningful

Next.ID recognizes the strengths of multiple approaches to identity (including Verifiable Credentials and Soulbound Tokens) and combines them by creating a sensible â€œLayer 0â€ for identities, ensuring that there will always be interoperability between different identity systems, held together by one unifying standard.

It is trustless, and we welcome all developers to audit the code on Github. If you like what you see, come build with the [community](https://github.com/nextdotid).

## How does Next.ID build an identity infrastructure?

* Just as people are infinitely dynamic, Next.ID allows users to create Avatars that are infinitely interoperable across both Web2 and Web3 platforms.
* Just as people recognize social groupings (e.g. age, race, nationality), Next.ID builds a framework that allows self-identification.

While Avatars who operate within a framework may sound like a national identity system, complete with social security numbers and Big Brotherâ€™s watchful eyes, there are a few key differences that show how Next.ID empowers users to own their identities and is not enslaved by them.

Avatars are

* Cryptographic key pairs, making them tamper-proof and unhackable
* Used on an opt-in basis, meaning you can create as many or as few of them as you want
* Usable and operationable across any platform that supports integration with Next.ID

In short, it is designed to on-board as many users as possible, helping them to create digital autonomy and credibility.

![Avatar Diagram - Verify and control who you are.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KkTVJMdWD6uGwfjr1Fmb5.png?height=991&width=1400)

![Avatar Interaction - Redefine and enrich social interactions.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Y4sZ8GGquc3p5UNqphUy8.png?height=991&width=1400)

*To understand why Next.ID is vital for the next evolution of the internet, please read [Why We Need To Own Our Digital Identities In A Decentralized World](https://medium.com/@Next.ID/why-we-need-to-own-our-digital-identities-in-a-decentralized-world-db2a8f9a3a7a).*

## SwapChat integrates Next.ID

Next.IDâ€™s capabilities can today be experienced by anyone. SwapChat, a Next.ID alpha test partner, is an instant messaging dApp across all Web3 pages that allows users to chat with buyers and sellers on OpenSea.

By integrating a DIaaS like Next.ID, SwapChat users now are able to negotiate prices with buyers and sellers via their Avatars on OpenSea, allowing for more efficient price discovery. Users can also use Avatars to discover communities via Twitter and Discord, leveraging SwapChatâ€™s integration of multiple social platforms.

The list of protocols and dApps using Next.ID is growing weekly. Here are just some of them:

1. Mask Network â€” Permissionless platform that bridges Web2 users to Web3
2. KNN3 â€” Social graph data solution for Web3 relational data exploration
3. RSS3 â€” Content syndication protocol that allows aggregation of Web2 and Web3 content
4. SwapChat/Web3MQ â€” Cross-platform chat protocols that allow users to send messages and group chats on OpenSea and Twitter to realize social NFT trading
5. Web3.bio â€” Frontend profile page for Web3 identities
6. .bit â€” Web3 data container and naming service that enables users to link ENS and other identity services

*Note: Next.ID is actively looking to grow its developer and partner ecosystem. Please reach out to us at [developer@next.id](http://developer@next.id/).*

## Technical breakthroughs that power Next.ID

**ProofService â€” Ensure data integrity with cryptography**

[ProofChain](https://docs.next.id/proof-service/ps-glossary#glossary-proof-chain) follows a blockchain-like model to retain data integrity, using cryptography and the private-public key pairing system. This ensures that only users with the right private keys will be able to add to the data in each â€œblockâ€.

ProofService and every change in its history are fully visible on Arweave, true to the Next.ID communityâ€™s commitment to full transparency for its protocols.

**KVService â€” Organize and make sense of the data provided by users**

As users and protocols read and write data using Next.ID, KVService sets up a framework to organize the information neatly. This enables smoother frontend usage of Next.ID, as well as allows developers a clearer understanding of how Next.ID can be utilized.

**RelationService â€” Enable comprehensive identity queries and social use cases**

RelationService is an aggregation of existing IDs, ID queries, and IDs bound to and in parallel to Next.ID, opening up a range of possibilities for integration with external protocols and creating greater Web3 native social use cases. Developers can access the prototype of RelationService server [here](https://relation-service.nextnext.id/).

## Build with Next.ID: Solve the Identity Crisis in Web3

If youâ€™re reading this even in the bear market, we have a proposal for you: build something that lasts.

Digital-Identity-as-a-Service will be the cornerstone on which Web3 will be built, as users get increasingly familiar with a digital economy. While the most recent bull run provided us with completely new and innovative liquidity mining primitives, it lacked sustainability. A sustainable future with true digital ownership is exactly what Next.ID is building.

Next.ID is looking for experienced developers who want to build on Next.ID as a public good, to create a framework that empowers users, and to create a digital society that stands apart from traditional constraints.

![Hyper Multi Graph - A scalable DID data framework to power the next-gen social graph.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SLnDqiNvddkFR2WQUQuMv.png?height=991&width=1400)

## Roadmap

**Phase 1 (Now-Dec 2022)**

1. Integrate more Web2 platforms, starting with: Discord, Medium, and TikTok
2. Debut a user-facing demo dApp (Web3.bio) that showcases the full suite of Next.IDâ€™s capabilities
3. Enlarge our RelationService database to aggregate more verifiable connections from other DID services and databases, making search queries more efficient and trustworthy.
4. Lay the groundwork for Next.ID to operate as an open-source community governed as a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO).

**Phase 2 (2023 and beyond)**

1. Build out the developer ecosystem, encouraging developers to ideate and execute projects in the Next.ID community
2. Co-develop projects with the community
3. Expand Next.ID adoption and applications in social media, gaming, security, and asset management

**Phase X (TBD)**

1. Build the framework for decentralized P2P nodes to enable users to self-host their data
2. Develop into a full-fledged DAO, allowing the community to decide a future roadmap.

Intrigued? Find out more at [docs.next.id](http://docs.next.id/) or reach out to us at [developer@next.id](http://developer@next.id/). Follow us on Twitter: @[NextDotID](https://twitter.com/NextDotID)

title: Tiny Bytes: Planning
body:
Yo,

Tonight, I got to writing too late to go in-depth so Iâ€™m going to use this post to help plan out my writing.

## Resources

call to action by NIST

[https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/post-quantum-cryptography](https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/post-quantum-cryptography)

NIST summary

[https://www.nist.gov/news-events/news/2022/07/nist-announces-first-four-quantum-resistant-cryptographic-algorithms](https://www.nist.gov/news-events/news/2022/07/nist-announces-first-four-quantum-resistant-cryptographic-algorithms)

chosen NIST

[https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/post-quantum-cryptography/selected-algorithms-2022](https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/post-quantum-cryptography/selected-algorithms-2022)

Really good post summarizing everything

[https://blog.cloudflare.com/nist-post-quantum-surprise/](https://blog.cloudflare.com/nist-post-quantum-surprise/)

Authorâ€™s publications

[https://bas.westerbaan.name/](https://bas.westerbaan.name/)

aes post quantum security

[https://eprint.iacr.org/2019/1208.pdf](https://eprint.iacr.org/2019/1208.pdf)

[https://blog.boot.dev/cryptography/is-aes-256-quantum-resistant/](https://blog.boot.dev/cryptography/is-aes-256-quantum-resistant/)

[https://thequantuminsider.com/2020/04/30/is-aes-256-quantum-resistant/](https://thequantuminsider.com/2020/04/30/is-aes-256-quantum-resistant/)

grovers

[https://crypto.stackexchange.com/questions/6712/is-aes-256-a-post-quantum-secure-cipher-or-not](https://crypto.stackexchange.com/questions/6712/is-aes-256-a-post-quantum-secure-cipher-or-not)

[https://journals.aps.org/prl/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevLett.79.325](https://journals.aps.org/prl/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevLett.79.325)

### Plan

I think I want to go off of Bas Westerbaanâ€™s excellent post and learn about any questions I have. 

The first question I have is about why is symmetric encryption post-quantum secure (you can see links above).

I also am curious about the competition itself.

## Caveat

It seems like Iâ€™m going to have to do A LOT of reading to understand this, which makes it hard to practice writing and explaining in an hour. I will need to play around with my cadence.

In my head, I know Iâ€™ll need to find extra time to focus and read up. I can make somedays read plus write notes or summary. Another option is to read sometime during the day or evening, write something quick about another topic, and get to writing the post the next day. 

I definitely want to present the final knowledge is a cohesive, elegant format. I want posts that I can show off and allow for easy learning. It doesnâ€™t have to be every post. I think what I should do is next month I should modify my writing format. Keep a more consistent, laid back posts that arenâ€™t everyday and add a once a week high quality post. I can use the next week or two to plan that out and spend extra time researching.

I like this plan. Iâ€™ll just have to execute.

Sleep tight,

Lucas

ps

Thinking about it more Iâ€™d like to do some world building posts.

In my head quick posts are:

* media review
* world building (new)
* reflections
* why topic is important
* simple tech
* research

Users can also use Avatars to discover communities via Twitter and Discord, leveraging SwapChatâ€™s integration of multiple social platforms.

The list of protocols and dApps using Next.ID is growing weekly. Here are just some of them:

1. Mask Network â€” Permissionless platform that bridges Web2 users to Web3
2. KNN3 â€” Social graph data solution for Web3 relational data exploration
3. RSS3 â€” Content syndication protocol that allows aggregation of Web2 and Web3 content
4. SwapChat/Web3MQ â€” Cross-platform chat protocols that allow users to send messages and group chats on OpenSea and Twitter to realize social NFT trading
5. Web3.bio â€” Frontend profile page for Web3 identities
6. .bit â€” Web3 data container and naming service that enables users to link ENS and other identity services

*Note: Next.ID is actively looking to grow its developer and partner ecosystem. Please reach out to us at [developer@next.id](http://developer@next.id/).*

## Technical breakthroughs that power Next.ID

**ProofService â€” Ensure data integrity with cryptography**

[ProofChain](https://docs.next.id/proof-service/ps-glossary#glossary-proof-chain) follows a blockchain-like model to retain data integrity, using cryptography and the private-public key pairing system. This ensures that only users with the right private keys will be able to add to the data in each â€œblockâ€.

ProofService and every change in its history are fully visible on Arweave, true to the Next.ID communityâ€™s commitment to full transparency for its protocols.

**KVService â€” Organize and make sense of the data provided by users**

As users and protocols read and write data using Next.ID, KVService sets up a framework to organize the information neatly. This enables smoother frontend usage of Next.ID, as well as allows developers a clearer understanding of how Next.ID can be utilized.

**RelationService â€” Enable comprehensive identity queries and social use cases**

RelationService is an aggregation of existing IDs, ID queries, and IDs bound to and in parallel to Next.ID, opening up a range of possibilities for integration with external protocols and creating greater Web3 native social use cases. Developers can access the prototype of RelationService server [here](https://relation-service.nextnext.id/).

## Build with Next.ID: Solve the Identity Crisis in Web3

If youâ€™re reading this even in the bear market, we have a proposal for you: build something that lasts.

Digital-Identity-as-a-Service will be the cornerstone on which Web3 will be built, as users get increasingly familiar with a digital economy. While the most recent bull run provided us with completely new and innovative liquidity mining primitives, it lacked sustainability. A sustainable future with true digital ownership is exactly what Next.ID is building.

Next.ID is looking for experienced developers who want to build on Next.ID as a public good, to create a framework that empowers users, and to create a digital society that stands apart from traditional constraints.

![Hyper Multi Graph - A scalable DID data framework to power the next-gen social graph.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SLnDqiNvddkFR2WQUQuMv.png?height=991&width=1400)

## Roadmap

**Phase 1 (Now-Dec 2022)**

1. Integrate more Web2 platforms, starting with: Discord, Medium, and TikTok
2. Debut a user-facing demo dApp (Web3.bio) that showcases the full suite of Next.IDâ€™s capabilities
3. Enlarge our RelationService database to aggregate more verifiable connections from other DID services and databases, making search queries more efficient and trustworthy.
4. Lay the groundwork for Next.ID to operate as an open-source community governed as a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO).

**Phase 2 (2023 and beyond)**

1. Build out the developer ecosystem, encouraging developers to ideate and execute projects in the Next.ID community
2. Co-develop projects with the community
3. Expand Next.ID adoption and applications in social media, gaming, security, and asset management

**Phase X (TBD)**

1. Build the framework for decentralized P2P nodes to enable users to self-host their data
2. Develop into a full-fledged DAO, allowing the community to decide a future roadmap.

Intrigued? Find out more at [docs.next.id](http://docs.next.id/) or reach out to us at [developer@next.id](http://developer@next.id/). Follow us on Twitter: @[NextDotID](https://twitter.com/NextDotID)
