title: Next.ID Aggregates Identities Across Web2 and Web3, Giving Data Ownership Back To Users
body:
## Next.ID: The worldâ€™s first Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS)

[Next.ID](https://next.id/), the worldâ€™s first protocol offering Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS) is moving into beta testing. It is a decentralized identity aggregation protocol that integrates all Web2 and Web3 digital identities, offering a comprehensive and verifiable identity database for open-source developers and projects to innovate and build dApps on.

As the worldâ€™s first DIaaS, Next.ID creates an identity infrastructure that securely aggregates usersâ€™ identities into Avatars, making it the primary touch point for interfacing with any app or dApp.

![Next.ID's role in the ecosystem](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iOytcopPQvTOgd0KOdQ2h.png?height=788&width=1400)

Next.IDâ€™s Avatars exist independently from Web2 and Web3, using a blockchain-like model to retain data integrity. This allows Next.ID to connect to all Web2 and Web3 platforms, aggregating all identities in a fully-agnostic way, unifying them into one single decentralized identifier (DID).

Welcome to the future of Digital Identity.

## The most seamless DID aggregator for Web3 builders

* The ideal DIaaS System must be built with an architecture that prioritizes identity safety and data privacy
* A universal Digital Identity management system must consolidate identifiers across chains and platforms in both Web2 & Web3 so identity data can be useful and meaningful

Next.ID recognizes the strengths of multiple approaches to identity (including Verifiable Credentials and Soulbound Tokens) and combines them by creating a sensible â€œLayer 0â€ for identities, ensuring that there will always be interoperability between different identity systems, held together by one unifying standard.

It is trustless, and we welcome all developers to audit the code on Github. If you like what you see, come build with the [community](https://github.com/nextdotid).

## How does Next.ID build an identity infrastructure?

* Just as people are infinitely dynamic, Next.ID allows users to create Avatars that are infinitely interoperable across both Web2 and Web3 platforms.
* Just as people recognize social groupings (e.g. age, race, nationality), Next.ID builds a framework that allows self-identification.

While Avatars who operate within a framework may sound like a national identity system, complete with social security numbers and Big Brotherâ€™s watchful eyes, there are a few key differences that show how Next.ID empowers users to own their identities and is not enslaved by them.

Avatars are

* Cryptographic key pairs, making them tamper-proof and unhackable
* Used on an opt-in basis, meaning you can create as many or as few of them as you want
* Usable and operationable across any platform that supports integration with Next.ID

In short, it is designed to on-board as many users as possible, helping them to create digital autonomy and credibility.

![Avatar Diagram - Verify and control who you are.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KkTVJMdWD6uGwfjr1Fmb5.png?height=991&width=1400)

![Avatar Interaction - Redefine and enrich social interactions.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Y4sZ8GGquc3p5UNqphUy8.png?height=991&width=1400)

*To understand why Next.ID is vital for the next evolution of the internet, please read [Why We Need To Own Our Digital Identities In A Decentralized World](https://medium.com/@Next.ID/why-we-need-to-own-our-digital-identities-in-a-decentralized-world-db2a8f9a3a7a).*

## SwapChat integrates Next.ID

Next.IDâ€™s capabilities can today be experienced by anyone. SwapChat, a Next.ID alpha test partner, is an instant messaging dApp across all Web3 pages that allows users to chat with buyers and sellers on OpenSea.

By integrating a DIaaS like Next.ID, SwapChat users now are able to negotiate prices with buyers and sellers via their Avatars on OpenSea, allowing for more efficient price discovery. Users can also use Avatars to discover communities via Twitter and Discord, leveraging SwapChatâ€™s integration of multiple social platforms.

The list of protocols and dApps using Next.ID is growing weekly. Here are just some of them:

1. Mask Network â€” Permissionless platform that bridges Web2 users to Web3
2. KNN3 â€” Social graph data solution for Web3 relational data exploration
3. RSS3 â€” Content syndication protocol that allows aggregation of Web2 and Web3 content
4. SwapChat/Web3MQ â€” Cross-platform chat protocols that allow users to send messages and group chats on OpenSea and Twitter to realize social NFT trading
5. Web3.bio â€” Frontend profile page for Web3 identities
6. .bit â€” Web3 data container and naming service that enables users to link ENS and other identity services

*Note: Next.ID is actively looking to grow its developer and partner ecosystem. Please reach out to us at [developer@next.id](http://developer@next.id/).*

## Technical breakthroughs that power Next.ID

**ProofService â€” Ensure data integrity with cryptography**

[ProofChain](https://docs.next.id/proof-service/ps-glossary#glossary-proof-chain) follows a blockchain-like model to retain data integrity, using cryptography and the private-public key pairing system. This ensures that only users with the right private keys will be able to add to the data in each â€œblockâ€.

ProofService and every change in its history are fully visible on Arweave, true to the Next.ID communityâ€™s commitment to full transparency for its protocols.

**KVService â€” Organize and make sense of the data provided by users**

As users and protocols read and write data using Next.ID, KVService sets up a framework to organize the information neatly. This enables smoother frontend usage of Next.ID, as well as allows developers a clearer understanding of how Next.ID can be utilized.

**RelationService â€” Enable comprehensive identity queries and social use cases**

RelationService is an aggregation of existing IDs, ID queries, and IDs bound to and in parallel to Next.ID, opening up a range of possibilities for integration with external protocols and creating greater Web3 native social use cases. Developers can access the prototype of RelationService server [here](https://relation-service.nextnext.id/).

## Build with Next.ID: Solve the Identity Crisis in Web3

If youâ€™re reading this even in the bear market, we have a proposal for you: build something that lasts.

Digital-Identity-as-a-Service will be the cornerstone on which Web3 will be built, as users get increasingly familiar with a digital economy. While the most recent bull run provided us with completely new and innovative liquidity mining primitives, it lacked sustainability. A sustainable future with true digital ownership is exactly what Next.ID is building.

Next.ID is looking for experienced developers who want to build on Next.ID as a public good, to create a framework that empowers users, and to create a digital society that stands apart from traditional constraints.

![Hyper Multi Graph - A scalable DID data framework to power the next-gen social graph.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SLnDqiNvddkFR2WQUQuMv.png?height=991&width=1400)

## Roadmap

**Phase 1 (Now-Dec 2022)**

1. Integrate more Web2 platforms, starting with: Discord, Medium, and TikTok
2. Debut a user-facing demo dApp (Web3.bio) that showcases the full suite of Next.IDâ€™s capabilities
3. Enlarge our RelationService database to aggregate more verifiable connections from other DID services and databases, making search queries more efficient and trustworthy.
4. Lay the groundwork for Next.ID to operate as an open-source community governed as a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO).

**Phase 2 (2023 and beyond)**

1. Build out the developer ecosystem, encouraging developers to ideate and execute projects in the Next.ID community
2. Co-develop projects with the community
3. Expand Next.ID adoption and applications in social media, gaming, security, and asset management

**Phase X (TBD)**

1. Build the framework for decentralized P2P nodes to enable users to self-host their data
2. Develop into a full-fledged DAO, allowing the community to decide a future roadmap.

Intrigued? Find out more at [docs.next.id](http://docs.next.id/) or reach out to us at [developer@next.id](http://developer@next.id/). Follow us on Twitter: @[NextDotID](https://twitter.com/NextDotID)

title: KNN3 Network and Next.ID Reached an Official Strategic Partnership in Web3 On-chain Data Collaboration
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SQdj4tsR7yZNI2XSdz-Tn.png?height=650&width=1304)

Hey KNN3 builders,

We are thrilled to announce a strategic partnership with Next.ID.

The partnership will focus on Web3 on-chain data collaboration. KNN3 Network willÂ  assist Next.ID to aggregate on-chain behaviors as well as Web3 multiverse relations with DIDs, which is one of our DCP (Data Collaboration Proposals) use cases. It will make Next.IDâ€™s data more composable and scalable. Meanwhile, KNN3 Network is able to use Next.ID publicly-assessible API to enrich our Web3 database.

This partnership will allow a wider user base and strengthen usersâ€™ gateway to Web3. We look forward to observing how it will evolve into a mutually rewarding meaningful association.Â 

You can find out more about what Next.ID does as well as their roadmap [here](https://medium.com/@Next.ID/next-id-aggregates-identities-across-web2-and-web3-giving-data-ownership-back-to-users-97818034e956).

## About Next.ID

Next.ID is an open-source protocol that synergizes your Web2 and Web3 profiles. Next.ID connects and authenticates your digital footprints, along with the full ownership of your identities. 
  
 [Website](https://next.id/) |[ Twitter](https://twitter.com/NextDotID) |[ GitHub](https://github.com/nextdotid) |[ Developer Docs](https://docs.next.id/?utm_source=nextid) | [RalationService Server](https://relation-service.nextnext.id/) | [Medium](https://medium.com/@Next.ID)

## About KNN3 Network

KNN3 is Web3 Relationship Aggregator on multi-blockchains. Empowering Web3 social discovery & user enabling. KNN3 Network provides graph solutions for web3 multiverse relational aggregation to empower Social d/App and AI analytics. KNN3 aims to become a community-driven data curation protocol to enable on-chain data collaboration.

[Website](http://www.knn3.xyz/) |[ Twitter](https://twitter.com/Knn3Network) |[ Discord](https://discord.gg/sQbqDT4hxs) |[ Mirror](https://mirror.xyz/knn3.eth) |[ Medium](https://medium.com/@KNN3_Network)

title: huwaa
body: huwaa

title: Next.ID Aggregates Identities Across Web2 and Web3, Giving Data Ownership Back To Users
body:
## Next.ID: The worldâ€™s first Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS)

[Next.ID](https://next.id/), the worldâ€™s first protocol offering Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS) is moving into beta testing. It is a decentralized identity aggregation protocol that integrates all Web2 and Web3 digital identities, offering a comprehensive and verifiable identity database for open-source developers and projects to innovate and build dApps on.

As the worldâ€™s first DIaaS, Next.ID creates an identity infrastructure that securely aggregates usersâ€™ identities into Avatars, making it the primary touch point for interfacing with any app or dApp.

![Next.ID's role in the ecosystem](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iOytcopPQvTOgd0KOdQ2h.png?height=788&width=1400)

Next.IDâ€™s Avatars exist independently from Web2 and Web3, using a blockchain-like model to retain data integrity. This allows Next.ID to connect to all Web2 and Web3 platforms, aggregating all identities in a fully-agnostic way, unifying them into one single decentralized identifier (DID).

Welcome to the future of Digital Identity.

## The most seamless DID aggregator for Web3 builders

* The ideal DIaaS System must be built with an architecture that prioritizes identity safety and data privacy
* A universal Digital Identity management system must consolidate identifiers across chains and platforms in both Web2 & Web3 so identity data can be useful and meaningful

Next.ID recognizes the strengths of multiple approaches to identity (including Verifiable Credentials and Soulbound Tokens) and combines them by creating a sensible â€œLayer 0â€ for identities, ensuring that there will always be interoperability between different identity systems, held together by one unifying standard.

It is trustless, and we welcome all developers to audit the code on Github. If you like what you see, come build with the [community](https://github.com/nextdotid).

## How does Next.ID build an identity infrastructure?

* Just as people are infinitely dynamic, Next.ID allows users to create Avatars that are infinitely interoperable across both Web2 and Web3 platforms.
* Just as people recognize social groupings (e.g. age, race, nationality), Next.ID builds a framework that allows self-identification.

While Avatars who operate within a framework may sound like a national identity system, complete with social security numbers and Big Brotherâ€™s watchful eyes, there are a few key differences that show how Next.ID empowers users to own their identities and is not enslaved by them.

Avatars are

* Cryptographic key pairs, making them tamper-proof and unhackable
* Used on an opt-in basis, meaning you can create as many or as few of them as you want
* Usable and operationable across any platform that supports integration with Next.ID

In short, it is designed to on-board as many users as possible, helping them to create digital autonomy and credibility.

![Avatar Diagram - Verify and control who you are.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KkTVJMdWD6uGwfjr1Fmb5.png?height=991&width=1400)

![Avatar Interaction - Redefine and enrich social interactions.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Y4sZ8GGquc3p5UNqphUy8.png?height=991&width=1400)

*To understand why Next.ID is vital for the next evolution of the internet, please read [Why We Need To Own Our Digital Identities In A Decentralized World](https://medium.com/@Next.ID/why-we-need-to-own-our-digital-identities-in-a-decentralized-world-db2a8f9a3a7a).*

## SwapChat integrates Next.ID

Next.IDâ€™s capabilities can today be experienced by anyone. SwapChat, a Next.ID alpha test partner, is an instant messaging dApp across all Web3 pages that allows users to chat with buyers and sellers on OpenSea.

By integrating a DIaaS like Next.ID, SwapChat users now are able to negotiate prices with buyers and sellers via their Avatars on OpenSea, allowing for more efficient price discovery. Users can also use Avatars to discover communities via Twitter and Discord, leveraging SwapChatâ€™s integration of multiple social platforms.

The list of protocols and dApps using Next.ID is growing weekly. Here are just some of them:

1. Mask Network â€” Permissionless platform that bridges Web2 users to Web3
2. KNN3 â€” Social graph data solution for Web3 relational data exploration
3. RSS3 â€” Content syndication protocol that allows aggregation of Web2 and Web3 content
4. SwapChat/Web3MQ â€” Cross-platform chat protocols that allow users to send messages and group chats on OpenSea and Twitter to realize social NFT trading
5. Web3.bio â€” Frontend profile page for Web3 identities
6. .bit â€” Web3 data container and naming service that enables users to link ENS and other identity services

*Note: Next.ID is actively looking to grow its developer and partner ecosystem. Please reach out to us at [developer@next.id](http://developer@next.id/).*

## Technical breakthroughs that power Next.ID

**ProofService â€” Ensure data integrity with cryptography**

[ProofChain](https://docs.next.id/proof-service/ps-glossary#glossary-proof-chain) follows a blockchain-like model to retain data integrity, using cryptography and the private-public key pairing system. This ensures that only users with the right private keys will be able to add to the data in each â€œblockâ€.

ProofService and every change in its history are fully visible on Arweave, true to the Next.ID communityâ€™s commitment to full transparency for its protocols.

**KVService â€” Organize and make sense of the data provided by users**

As users and protocols read and write data using Next.ID, KVService sets up a framework to organize the information neatly. This enables smoother frontend usage of Next.ID, as well as allows developers a clearer understanding of how Next.ID can be utilized.

**RelationService â€” Enable comprehensive identity queries and social use cases**

RelationService is an aggregation of existing IDs, ID queries, and IDs bound to and in parallel to Next.ID, opening up a range of possibilities for integration with external protocols and creating greater Web3 native social use cases. Developers can access the prototype of RelationService server [here](https://relation-service.nextnext.id/).

## Build with Next.ID: Solve the Identity Crisis in Web3

If youâ€™re reading this even in the bear market, we have a proposal for you: build something that lasts.

Digital-Identity-as-a-Service will be the cornerstone on which Web3 will be built, as users get increasingly familiar with a digital economy. While the most recent bull run provided us with completely new and innovative liquidity mining primitives, it lacked sustainability. A sustainable future with true digital ownership is exactly what Next.ID is building.

Next.ID is looking for experienced developers who want to build on Next.ID as a public good, to create a framework that empowers users, and to create a digital society that stands apart from traditional constraints.

![Hyper Multi Graph - A scalable DID data framework to power the next-gen social graph.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SLnDqiNvddkFR2WQUQuMv.png?height=991&width=1400)

## Roadmap

**Phase 1 (Now-Dec 2022)**

1. Integrate more Web2 platforms, starting with: Discord, Medium, and TikTok
2. Debut a user-facing demo dApp (Web3.bio) that showcases the full suite of Next.IDâ€™s capabilities
3. Enlarge our RelationService database to aggregate more verifiable connections from other DID services and databases, making search queries more efficient and trustworthy.
4. Lay the groundwork for Next.ID to operate as an open-source community governed as a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO).

**Phase 2 (2023 and beyond)**

1. Build out the developer ecosystem, encouraging developers to ideate and execute projects in the Next.ID community
2. Co-develop projects with the community
3. Expand Next.ID adoption and applications in social media, gaming, security, and asset management

**Phase X (TBD)**

1. Build the framework for decentralized P2P nodes to enable users to self-host their data
2. Develop into a full-fledged DAO, allowing the community to decide a future roadmap.

Intrigued? Find out more at [docs.next.id](http://docs.next.id/) or reach out to us at [developer@next.id](http://developer@next.id/). Follow us on Twitter: @[NextDotID](https://twitter.com/NextDotID)

## Next.ID: The worldâ€™s first Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS)

[Next.ID](https://next.id/), the worldâ€™s first protocol offering Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS) is moving into beta testing. It is a decentralized identity aggregation protocol that integrates all Web2 and Web3 digital identities, offering a comprehensive and verifiable identity database for open-source developers and projects to innovate and build dApps on.

As the worldâ€™s first DIaaS, Next.ID creates an identity infrastructure that securely aggregates usersâ€™ identities into Avatars, making it the primary touch point for interfacing with any app or dApp.

![Next.ID's role in the ecosystem](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iOytcopPQvTOgd0KOdQ2h.png?height=788&width=1400)

Next.IDâ€™s Avatars exist independently from Web2 and Web3, using a blockchain-like model to retain data integrity. This allows Next.ID to connect to all Web2 and Web3 platforms, aggregating all identities in a fully-agnostic way, unifying them into one single decentralized identifier (DID).

Welcome to the future of Digital Identity.

## The most seamless DID aggregator for Web3 builders

* The ideal DIaaS System must be built with an architecture that prioritizes identity safety and data privacy
* A universal Digital Identity management system must consolidate identifiers across chains and platforms in both Web2 & Web3 so identity data can be useful and meaningful

Next.ID recognizes the strengths of multiple approaches to identity (including Verifiable Credentials and Soulbound Tokens) and combines them by creating a sensible â€œLayer 0â€ for identities, ensuring that there will always be interoperability between different identity systems, held together by one unifying standard.

It is trustless, and we welcome all developers to audit the code on Github. If you like what you see, come build with the [community](https://github.com/nextdotid).

## How does Next.ID build an identity infrastructure?

* Just as people are infinitely dynamic, Next.ID allows users to create Avatars that are infinitely interoperable across both Web2 and Web3 platforms.
* Just as people recognize social groupings (e.g. age, race, nationality), Next.ID builds a framework that allows self-identification.

While Avatars who operate within a framework may sound like a national identity system, complete with social security numbers and Big Brotherâ€™s watchful eyes, there are a few key differences that show how Next.ID empowers users to own their identities and is not enslaved by them.

Avatars are

* Cryptographic key pairs, making them tamper-proof and unhackable
* Used on an opt-in basis, meaning you can create as many or as few of them as you want
* Usable and operationable across any platform that supports integration with Next.ID

In short, it is designed to on-board as many users as possible, helping them to create digital autonomy and credibility.

As users and protocols read and write data using Next.ID, KVService sets up a framework to organize the information neatly. This enables smoother frontend usage of Next.ID, as well as allows developers a clearer understanding of how Next.ID can be utilized.

ì¥ë¶€ëŠ” ê¶Œí•œì„ í™•ì¸í•˜ëŠ” ì—­í• ì„ í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì¥ë¶€ëŠ” ëˆ„ê°€ êµ­íšŒì˜ì›ì˜ ìê²©ì„ ê°€ì§ˆ ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ”ì§€, ëˆ„ê°€ ì–´ë–¤ ì€í–‰ ê³„ì¢Œì—ì„œ ëˆì„ ì¸ì¶œí•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ”ì§€, ëˆ„ê°€ ì•„ì´ë“¤ê³¼ ê´€ë ¨ëœ ì¼ì„ í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆê³ , ëˆ„ê°€ ì œí•œ êµ¬ì—­ì— ë“¤ì–´ê°ˆ ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ”ì§€ íŒŒì•…í•˜ëŠ” ì—­í• ì„ í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

title: KNN3 Network and Next.ID Reached an Official Strategic Partnership in Web3 On-chain Data Collaboration
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SQdj4tsR7yZNI2XSdz-Tn.png?height=650&width=1304)

**Hey KNN3 builders,**

We are thrilled to announce a strategic partnership with Next.ID.

The partnership will focus on Web3 on-chain data collaboration. KNN3 Network willÂ  assist Next.ID to aggregate on-chain behaviors as well as Web3 multiverse relations with DIDs, which is one of our DCP (Data Collaboration Proposals) use cases. It will make Next.IDâ€™s data more composable and scalable. Meanwhile, KNN3 Network is able to use Next.ID publicly-assessible API to enrich our Web3 database.

This partnership will allow a wider user base and strengthen usersâ€™ gateway to Web3. We look forward to observing how it will evolve into a mutually rewarding meaningful association.

You can find out more about what Next.ID does as well as their roadmap [here](https://medium.com/@Next.ID/next-id-aggregates-identities-across-web2-and-web3-giving-data-ownership-back-to-users-97818034e956).

### About Next.ID

Next.ID is an open-source protocol that synergizes your Web2 and Web3 profiles. Next.ID connects and authenticates your digital footprints, along with the full ownership of your identities.

[Website](https://next.id/) |[ Twitter](https://twitter.com/NextDotID) |[ GitHub](https://github.com/nextdotid) |[ Developer Docs](https://docs.next.id/?utm_source=nextid) | [RalationService Server](https://relation-service.nextnext.id/) | [Medium](https://medium.com/@Next.ID)

### About KNN3 Network

KNN3 is Web3 Relationship Aggregator on multi-blockchains. Empowering Web3 social discovery & user enabling. KNN3 Network provides graph solutions for web3 multiverse relational aggregation to empower Social d/App and AI analytics. KNN3 aims to become a community-driven data curation protocol to enable on-chain data collaboration.

[Website](http://www.knn3.xyz/) |[ Twitter](https://twitter.com/Knn3Network) |[ Discord](https://discord.gg/sQbqDT4hxs) |[ Mirror](https://mirror.xyz/knn3.eth) |[ Medium](https://medium.com/@KNN3_Network)

title: Welcome to Omnea
body:
Besides enriching our lives by uniting us across the humanity and nourishing our inner world with purpose; arts and culture has an huge impact on society, education, health, well-being and economy. And we, as Omnea, believe that expanding the horizon of arts and culture is crucial for a pluralist, progressive and harmonious society.

In the last decade, open resources to learn, more accessible tools to create, platforms to share in combination with the mobile connectedness and high speed internet have led to a creative economy boom generated by users. However, these rapid developments challenge artists, creators and arts and culture organizations to create before experiment, and present while trying to keep connected in a overwhelmingly fast world.

When the pandemic hit, we all took a long pause. This break revealed fragilities and unfair parts of the arts and culture industry alongside areas to expand and missed opportunities for all actors. But jumping on the digital hype train involuntarily have brought more challenges in terms of design, communication as well as human and production resources. For the last two years, we work towards defining the problem while building and experimenting on many levels.

> Omnea is collective efforts of designers, builders and thinkers coming from diverse backgrounds including digital experience design, new media art, academic research, exhibition design, contemporary museology and event design in order to exploring novel ways of exhibiting and performing while getting socialized in interactive virtual and physical environments backed by a value-based financial incentives.

We believe that Omnea will fill an enormous gap by offering intuitive and easy to use tools and frameworks that helps to lower the barriers to a metaverse future and onboard not just artists, creators and institutions but also welcome all art and culture lovers.

Omnea priorities meaningful relationships, inclusivity and diversity rather than building an economy prone to speculation. To ensure a fair distribution of power and wealth, Omnea will leverage new generation DeFi and NFTs mechanics.

We are open for collaborations and eager to hear how we can build Omnea together. Please join our discord server, say hi or give us a follow to keep updated about how Omnea will fold out.

We are very excited to welcome you to Omnea.

title: Fiercely fought

# 40 Money And Space Saving Hacks That Make Owning A Car Cheaper And Simpler

By [Aayush G](https://morehackz.com/author/aayush-g/) February 27, 2022


---

Cars are, hands down, the best inventions in modern history; nowadays, itâ€™s hard to imagine a world without vehicles. If you live in the suburbs or rural areas, then you know how important it is to have a fully functioning car. Although our cars make it easy for us to commute to work and go on grocery runs, it is a job in and of itself to keep them maintained. Problems that come with cars are endless, and while many are something only professionals can deal with, there are many others that anyone can handle. Weâ€™re here to help you with a few of them to make driving simpler. The hacks, tips, and tricks on this list are easy for anyone to do. Have you tried any of these yourself? If so, let us know which is your favorite!

title: Test Email Notification
body: This is exciting!

title: WHOSE KNOT IS IT ANYWAY
body:
**KNOTS is a meta-programmatic NFT project by Emily Segal and Deluge Books**

**Launching February 18, 2022 at [knots.live](https://knots.live/)**

**Public minting begins at 12pm PST**

**For more information check out [INTRODUCING KNOTS](https://emily.mirror.xyz/jsJXdEbAuCom1RWT5NEnZ2bmyGkSNO-63ZWRFlvk1Rk)**

Knots make me question origin and agency. They remind me of a friendâ€™s trip report, from their first time dropping acid, at carnival in Rio. The experience had delivered a single self-contained epiphany that they'd whispered over and over to their friend, perfectly brilliant and perfectly banal: "we are the memes of trees". Like that acid koan, the knots are perfect codes of their own uniqueness, too fundamental for human authorship. Instead, they meme themselves through us, through our DNA (which is knot-like in structure), through folklore and craft, and through stories. After all,Â the resolution of a plot is the denouement, the unknotting.

Put another way: knots are situation comedies or tragedies, waiting to be sliced through, undone, or tightened. Looping around themselves, knots are symbols or pictograms for stories which don't often go left to right, past to future, as we are taught on the chalkboard in English class. Stories are more like the cycles of the heavenly bodies around the ecliptic or the tangles of proteins in our bodies than they are pure linear vectors.Â Like poetic language, knot theory quickly reaches the edges of what we are capable of processing, cognitively or computationally.

AÂ  1930 text by the German Jewish historian Solomon Gandz argued that knots were the precursor of human writing systems. For Gandz, there are three phases â€œin the preservation of old traditions and laws... i) Memory pure and simple; re-petition and transmission by oral tradition to the children; 2) Knots and mnemonic signs, the precursors of writing, and 3) Writing.â€ He connected the mentions of knotted cords in the bible with the Incan tradition of quipu making â€“ massive knotted registers of history and accounting (the quipu has a particular resonance with blockchains and ledgers, evidenced by the Tezos project quipuswap).

To quote Gandz further:

> *â€œKnotted cords were the tangible and visible signs and symbols recording the abstract numbers, the facts, poems, and laws of the past, the historical events and traditions. Their purpose was to call up a recollection, to give it a body, to render it active and thereby actual. Knotted cords were the first memory- drawers and registers, they were the primitive tools out of which developed the powerful memory-machine of our modern writing, they were the primitive memory-huts and tents out of which grew up that gigantic structure that we call literature, history, and science.â€*

As all this knot-lore accrued in my mind, various Web 3 artworks crossed my desk that used variations on a theme, some with computer-generated or on-chain randomness, in editions of hundreds or thousands. Knots offered themselves gorgeously to this format, as each additional crossing and loop creates a unique situation, opening up various portals to various hyperspaces, as demonstrated by mathematician William Thurston in this video lecture, [Knots to Narnia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IKSrBt2kFD4).

Knots as individual artworks, as pieces of an imaginary proto-language, seemed like perfect tokens of appreciation for the existing supporters of $NOVEL (for whom a polished textual preview of the novel they funded is still a ways away). This method was also an interesting way to continue the experiment in using Web 3 to advance literary publishing through Deluge Books, both as a fundraising tool, and as a way to loop people into the future of my novel-in-progress, by connecting them to the project in general, and to special surprise easter eggs through the metadata in particular (more on that in coming months). As a first step, the opening paragraph of BURN ALPHA (the text supported by $NOVEL) is embedded in the environment reflected by each knot, but not legibly.

Knots collaborator Chris Reppucci, astrologer and pattern designer, worked with us to activate and organize the knots metaphysically. Early on in the process, divination had revealed the importance of making sure the knots didn't inadvertently bring negative energetic charge to those who held them. One way to ensure this was through the environment embedded in the 3D rendering of each knot: a spherical photograph of a place with perfect feng shui, as well as energetically attuned lighting placement, colors and textures for maximal user harmony. We also embedded ancient formulae in the smart contract from a foundational text of Western esotericism - bridging several thousand years of coding reality, through text, image, and technology. Each scene and lighting design for the knots carries a particular set of qualities related to dynamic correspondences of the four directions.

An amazing group of collaborators created this project â€“ Violet Office, Nemesis Global, Wurmhumus Fabrik, Deluge Books, and Chris Reppucci â€“ which speaks to the collective spirit of new projects in this space and jives with the [air triplicity period we recently entered](https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2020/dec/21/great-conjunction-new-astrological-epoch-emily-segal).

Holders of $NOVEL mint for free plus gas, and other dear communities in our network will have special access to the presale (see the [INTRODUCING KNOTS](https://emily.mirror.xyz/jsJXdEbAuCom1RWT5NEnZ2bmyGkSNO-63ZWRFlvk1Rk) announcement for more details). A portion of each primary sale will go toward funding publishing projects at Deluge Books â€“ queer, trans, experimental and otherwise undersupported literary projects â€“ and 100% of secondary sales will go to Deluge as well. We're excited about the prospect of bringing together traditional modes of publishing with Web 3 tools to create a more collectivized model for publishing literary work, and this is one step in the process.

From knots to Narnia we go.

**[KNOTS](https://knots.live/) launches Friday, February 18, 2022 at [KNOTS.LIVE](https://knots.live/)**

**Public minting begins at 12pm PST**

**Follow us on Twitter for updates: [@k_n_o_t_s_](https://twitter.com/k_n_o_t_s_)**

*Header Image: [Three-dimensional crystals of adaptive knots](https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.aay1638)*

title: What Is a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO)?
body:
A decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) is an organization that runs on a blockchain protocol fully and autonomously in accordance with rules encoded via smart contracts and its underlying consensus mechanism. By circumventing the need for human intervention or centralized coordination, DAOs enable previously unattainable levels of transparency, cost savings, and decentralized decision-making

### DAO as a Solution to the Principal-Agent Dilemma

* A decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) is a blockchain-specific organizational model that addresses the principal-agent dilemma
* Whenever a system is structured in a way in which an individual or entity (the "agent") has the ability to make decisions or take actions on behalf of another individual (the principal), there is an inherent risk in the divergent goals, priorities, or access to crucial information of the respective parties
* Aiming to address this problem by reducing or bypassing the need for hierarchical human intervention or centralized coordination, DAO is often referred to as "trustless" systems
* By ensuring that the incentive structures and information flow within an organization are properly aligned in a codified format, DAOs play a central role in mitigating the typical problems associated with the principal dilemma

### How Does DAO Work?

* Smart contract setup
* Before a DAO can be deployed, the underlying rules must be defined and encoded in a series of smart contracts
* Funding
* The DAO's smart contracts must entail the creation and distribution of some form of internal property
* Deployment
* All decisions are made via a consensus vote

### Applying DAO to the real world

* There are numerous legal and operational challenges these organizations must overcome
* Changing a DAO's code or smart contract structure requires a consensus vote
* Malicious actors could possibly exploit a bug or design flaw before the DAOâ€™s stakeholders manage to collectively resolve the issue
* DAOs have continued to gain traction in the marketplace
* At present, there are a number of promising blockchain projects that have fully incorporated decentralized governance mechanisms

title: Blockchains for Normies
body:
### DESCRIPTION

A first-step guide to raise your knowledge about blockchainsâ€™ architecture. This article is a selection of various materials, including articles and videos, arranged in the chronological order to achieve the highest level of effectiveness in step-by-step learning.

I have to clarify â€“ thatâ€™s NOT a guide for total beginners in crypto. All content mentioned in the article is for those who are aware of the basic terminology & crypto market in general. FYI, the guide is based on my personal experience.

### CONTENTS

**DESCRIPTION  
 PART 1 â€“ INTRODUCTION 
 PART 2 â€“ BLOCKCHAINS  
 2.1 â€“ Ethereum  
 2.2 â€“ Cosmos  
 2.3 â€“ Rollups  
 2.4 â€“ Solana  
 2.5 â€“ Near  
 PART 3 â€“ CONCLUSION**

> Hey, thanks for checking out! If you donâ€™t like author to be talkative, just skip the introduction and jump directly to **PART 2**.

## PART 1 â€“ INTRODUCTION

Lately, Iâ€™ve heard a lot of similar opinions like â€œThatâ€™s the best time to prepare yourself for the next bull marketâ€ or â€œGet out of charts and do some education insteadâ€. If you actively participated in all the â€œdegenâ€ plays with tokens and NFTs, or were busy as a day-trader for a while, Iâ€™d presume there wasnâ€™t enough time for such a silly thing as an **Education**. But isnâ€™t that finally a perfect time as people keep telling us? What if we shift our focus to learn something fundamental? Of course, Itâ€™s always nice to earn money by investing or speculating on one or another asset. Especially, when we saw such a great performance of most of the projects and especially blockchains in 2021.

![ATOM/USD â€“ Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8eJdnSpY41ZFz7qR1dRUx.png?height=1189&width=1813)

![SOL/USD â€“ Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zftEaJUKtu7syUpofERTE.png?height=1190&width=1820)

And Iâ€™m sure many of you got extremely good profits along with that rise. But here are few questions â€œ**Were you aware that LUNAâ€™s death loop is inevitable? Did you try to buy this dip?â€.** I have a feeling there are some, at least, who were not and tried so (*either was I*). Letâ€™s not make the same mistakes again. Without further more (*I know you may get tired of a long introduction*) letâ€™s jump into what I prepared for you.

## PART 2 â€“ BLOCKCHAINS

So, education, huh? What can we start with? Iâ€™ve been thinking and perceived to start with just fundamental things â€“ **Blockchains** and **Ecosystems**. If youâ€™re interested in boosting your knowledge about blockchains and crypto in general, below youâ€™ll find a selection of the related articles/videos. I found them extremely useful and perfectly fit for non-tech guys or normies.

> I have to clarify that the author is aware about whitepapers and other official resources, and that it is the best way to get familiar with functionality of blockchains and crypto protocols. But since the topic of this article is â€œ**Blockchains for Normies**â€, I prepared a selection of easy to understand materials to form a basic knowledge of structure and understanding of various tech aspects.

### 2.1 â€“ ÎTHEREUM

We will start with the leading blockchain, the father of Smart contracts, DeFi and NFT â€“ **ETHEREUM**. Some of you could react as â€œWHAT?! Where the heck is Bitcoin??â€. Iâ€™m not a big fan of Bitcoin, to be honest, and, since the concept of both blockchains is pretty similar (*in relation to **proof-of-work** mechanism; please donâ€™t kill me, I know there is a big difference called **EVM** â€“ **Ethereum Virtual Machine***), I decided to start with that. The amazing article translated into various languages:
[How does Ethereum work, anyway?](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-ethereum-work-anyway).
(*I recommend to read it in English since improving English skills is our next big goal â€“ more about that later*).

> If you really decided to dive into all of these things, follow the chronology, since I organized that for better understanding of the whole blockchain theory. Terms met in the first articles can be mentioned in the following ones.

Also, itâ€™s quite compatible to watch this video in parallel with the first article:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s)

(*Especially if youâ€™re not familiar at all with **Decentralized finances**, **DApps** & **Smart contracts***).

### 2.2 â€“ COSMOS

Okay, weâ€™ve learnt some basic things about how the amazing technology of blockchain actually works. But you may ask â€œWhat about **proof-of-stake** concept? I heard many blockchains are based on it as on more energy efficient & more scalable analogueâ€ (*or just â€œWhatâ€™s next?â€*). Not a big deal â€“ the whole **validation & delegation** idea is greatly described in the next article about COSMOS ecosystem (*in 2 parts*):
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 1)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-1); 
 [How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 2)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-2).

â€Damn, man, youâ€™re just sending the articles of one particular authorâ€¦ You could send us her link and finish itâ€ â€“ ITâ€™S NOT MY FAULT that her articles are such great for normies. But donâ€™t judge me so fast, here will be more stuff.

### 2.3 â€“ ROLLUPS

As long as weâ€™re aware about the difference between **proof-of-stake** and **proof-of-work** mechanisms, letâ€™s talk about another hot topic â€“ **ZK ROLLUPS**. Thatâ€™s almost impossible you havenâ€™t seen at least some videos or threads about how promising rollups are, determining it as a next huge trend. I guess, thatâ€™s worthy not to put it away: [A normie's guide to rollups](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/a-normies-guide-to-rollups).
And the answer for â€œWhich one is the best finally in that infinite battle?â€ can be found [here](https://medium.com/offchainlabs/optimistic-rollups-the-present-and-future-of-ethereum-scaling-60fb9067ae87) and [here](https://blog.polygon.technology/zk-and-the-future-of-ethereum-scaling/).

**Spoiler:**
.
.
.
Nobody knows exactly.

### 2.4 â€“ Sâ—LANA

Next is **SOLANA**. The killer of Etheâ€¦ Okay, stop it. Nobody kills nobody. I guess weâ€™ve settled that long time ago, heh. We can start with this article giving us an idea of how the Solanaâ€™s **proof-of-history** concept works:
[What Is Solana (SOL)? Learn About Ethereumâ€™s Growing Rival](https://blockworks.co/what-is-solana-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-ethereum-rival/).

Then check out this video:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2)

And read the explanation by Solanaâ€™s founder Anatoly Yakovenko:
[Proof of History: A Clock for Blockchain](https://medium.com/solana-labs/proof-of-history-a-clock-for-blockchain-cf47a61a9274).

Seems more or less clear? I have to admit there are a lot of concerns and humors regarding Solanaâ€™s eligibility and transparency, especially regarding the concept of **proof-of-history**. But letâ€™s leave it for scientists and mathematicians like [Victor Shoup](https://www.shoup.net/papers/poh.pdf) (*You may* *have a look at it, but be careful, it can hurt your brain if youâ€™re not a sort of such guys*).

### 2.5 â€“ NEAR

Letâ€™s dive a little deeper and remind ourselves about **Ethereum 2.0**, its **proof-of-stake** mechanism and, what is the most important, learn about **sharding** technology (*we need it for better understanding of the functionality of our next candidate*). I have to warn you, this part is gonna be more complex comparing to the previous ones:
[Detailed overview of Ethereum 2.0 shard chains: Committees, Proposers and Attesters](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/detailed-overview-of-ethereum-2-0-shard-chains-committees-proposers-and-attesters-a9992d2fd103). (*Well, at least I felt this way*).

> Please note that TxFlow is not relevant at the moment. Itâ€™s still under development and testing, so you can skip it for now.

Great! Iâ€™m feeling how these articles are becoming easier and easier to deal with (*or not, because you just keep scrolling?!*).

![Author when you don't read the article carefully](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ufWQTbVfyKHwNPAGqPXyM.png?height=900&width=1333)

To be honest, I spent several days trying to find similar easy to read material about the **NEAR** Protocol, but either it was huge, either quite complicated. Finally here it is, right after I spent the whole day reading an official doc (*super lucky?*). But first, if youâ€™re not familiar with the Near protocol at all, briefly check this introduction from the official team: [The Beginnerâ€™s Guide to the NEAR Blockchain](https://near.org/blog/the-beginners-guide-to-the-near-blockchain/).

For the rests â€“ overview of the **Near** protocol: [NEAR Protocol ($NEAR)](https://thealpharchives.com/near-protocol-near).

If you havenâ€™t gone through all the links attached to this great article above (*bet 99% you havenâ€™t*), some parts might seem not so clear. Donâ€™t worry, thereâ€™re just 2 important links you need to open. But there is a tiny detailâ€¦ One of these links is exactly the one Iâ€™ve called â€œhugeâ€ earlier. If youâ€™re that crazy person â€“ try your passion and patience by reading these:
[Nightshades](https://near.org/downloads/Nightshade.pdf) (*just to clarify â€“ 37 pages, good luck*);
[Doomslug](https://near.org/blog/doomslug-comparison/) (*much shorter*).
Along with the tons of text, it also provides the illustrations which, imho, are pretty fruitful and worthy of time.

## PART 3 â€“ CONCLUSION

I guess thatâ€™s it. The idea was to provide you with an important base of knowledge of terms, structures and varieties about the blockchain industry. To sum up, careful studying all the materials mentioned above gives us a sufficient understanding of architectures and principles of **Layer 1** & **2 blockchains**, **Smart contracts**, **DApps**, **Rollups**, **Proof-of-work** & **Proof-of-stake mechanisms**. This knowledge will significantly simplify future studying of incredible **Crypto world**.

> Few more notes before leaving.

I already have some plans and ideas for the future articles, so in case you enjoyed reading such stuff, would you mind to subscribe my [twitter](https://twitter.com/macevoy_eth)? Youâ€™ll be notified immediately once itâ€™s ready! Oh, I forgot to give an idea whatâ€™s nextâ€¦ Well, I canâ€™t promise anything, but can give you some hint:

![Kinda a roadmap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9TN1BevBKMzA4-bEBj9E7.png?height=800&width=2000&&&&&&&&size=medium)

Thanks for your time and sincerely hope you found the whole article useful and valuable. Happy to see any comments & suggestions. See ya soon â¤.

title: 3 Role Types: Conclusion | Part 5/5 |Â #56
body:
\*This entry is a continuation of [3 Role Types: Contributor](https://mirror.xyz/brownrygg.eth/z8bVYMa-XL7n830PZdyGejH1ZAB6tfjrSNwLJna8w0s)

Thus far we have established that the foundational roles of someone looking to join a community are:

1. Observer role.
2. Participant role.
3. Contributor role.

Each role comes with its own context, expectations and appropriate actions; and if we can make those easy to understand, follow and execute, it makes creating a wonderful experience more likely.

**Letâ€™s dive a bit deeper into how they work together in practice.**

Now that we know why these roles are so important in theory, Iâ€™ll show how I have used them in mClub, to help the core team understand where to place our energy in creating experiences for the different roles.

To learn more about what mClub is, check out our info page here: [check it out.](https://app.charmverse.io/share/mclub/page-5970097191500756)

The three member core team have taken the last few months to restructure everything about the DAO from our vision to completely redesigning our discord server.

When it came to Discord redesign, the 3 role types became very handy. To provide some visual context we created a role map in Mural.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/x3co21OgTx1Av7t_iqLQV.png?height=745&width=1563)

The point of this map is give our brains space to see the different roles and start exploring different ways that members in that role could interact in a way that moves that whole DOA to its North Star.

Each circle corresponds with a certain role. We could frame it as a funnel of sorts, but with a completely different mentality. Instead of trying to fill the top of the funnel with as many people as possible, expecting leakage to turn out the best contributors, we use these different circles to truly understand what the roles need to thrive. If they choose to move onto the next stage they are welcome to, but we are not manipulating them in any way to move from circle to circle.

We can also deploy Strategic Empathy for each role and start asking ourselves:

* What amount of time or compensation would be optimal for a certain role?
* What would the member need to see/do/hear in order to empower them on the journey?
* What signals will communicate the right message to a role within a specific context of the discord?

More specifically, in the Observer circle we explore what the least amount of information needs to be presented to help the person feel safe and make sense of the new space. Even if they are able to join a certain activity, it would be clear that there is 0% expectation that they engage or interact.

In the Participant circle we explore what activities will help this person get exactly what they need to level up on their journey. In participating with these activities they realize that they belong here, and choose to engage in what the community has to offer. They are able to get value from this context for as long as they want to, with no strings attached.

In the Contributor circle we explore how we might be able to empower people who want to help build the community further than its current capacity would let it grow. This is compensation, governance, culture and project management get defined. The contributor circle is a sacred space that must be protected. If we want to build something meaningful in the long term, then traveling into the unknown with the right group of people becomes paramount. I write more about this [idea here](https://mirror.xyz/brownrygg.eth/ErEVS-_bq_DnYwH6nrUMgM2ClUhYQccH5Z0-GE4u0Ro).

In the diagram above there is also a circle for core team. I will explore ideas surrounding this team in future posts.

Once we have explored what elements in each circle could be, we can start designing what a member journey could look like through what I call an intent map. This tool is used to get clarity on what outcomes our ideal members are seeking, and what human and tech stack processes need to be put in place to pave they way for those outcomes to be realized.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5mhF7UpwYKQ0mFCSDdXeE.png?height=819&width=1351)

I will create a detailed overview of how an intent map works in future posts.

Following this process of designing for the three core roles - Observer, Participant and Contributor has greatly simplified the process for understanding where to focus our energies as core leadership team.

Deploying Strategic Empathy for these roles within the context of what change the DAO seeks to create, will significantly increase a sustainable and fun environment.

If you have any questions feel free to reach out @brownrygg.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

Learn more about DAO Experience Design:

[https://daoxd.xyz/](https://daoxd.xyz/)

title: Public Goods
body:
* [Gitcoin Discussion;](https://gov.gitcoin.co/t/rethinking-fdd-defending-against-fraud-optimizing-capital-allocation/11090) Rethinking FDD
  * This discussion poses questions about how to stop fraud and allocate capital in the most efficient way possible.
  * A part of the thesis is to promote the â€œgoodâ€ in the DAO:
    * â€œGoodâ€ includes usefulness, fairness, inclusiveness, and sustainability.
    * Surveys could be made to measure what the DAO sees as good and build off of said surveys
  * Another part is to minimize the â€œbadâ€:
    * The first part of bad would be the inefficiencies within the grant reviewing process.
      * This can be handled internally by an FDD team that has an optimal incentivization structure (to be made in the future).
    * The second part is capital capture by Sybils and airdrop farmers.
      * This needs to be further explored.
  * More questions need to be answered on this subject like what are the sensible KPIs FDD can define to track its own progress?

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mHI0tN2TIis8NVZv4hARZ.jpg?height=1440&width=2560)

***Infrastructure & Tooling***

* [Rocket Pool Tempcheck;](https://dao.rocketpool.net/t/proposal-to-turn-off-32-full-node-operator-deposits/827) Proposal to turn off 32 (Full) Node Operator Deposits
  * This proposal was set forward because a NO queue exists as a full mini-pool wheel half mini pools exist (which are always placed ahead of full mini-pools).
  * This means that the full mini-pools would advance at an unpredictable rate and even could be stalled for an indefinite amount of time.
  * This however has cons like lost opportunity costs for potential node operators in the future in the half mini-pools.
* [Pokt Tempcheck;](https://forum.pokt.network/t/pep-37-pokt-wallet-chrome-and-firefox-extension/3232) POKT Wallet - Chrome and Firefox Extension
  * This proposal is asking for $207,151 worth of $POKT for updating these features in the web browser extension:
    * BIP32 Mnemonic Wallet with ED25519 support (one phrase, many addresses)
    * Add up to 10 sub-addresses to better monitor multiple sources of income/expenses
    * Add/edit a nickname for each address added to the wallet
    * Recover wallet with Recovery Phrase
    * Full-screen mode
    * Track and view all transactions
    * One-click access to POKTwatch
    * One-click locking of the wallet
    * One-click copy of your wallet address
    * View $USD value of your $POKT
    * Import and export of private keys
    * Access to native Pocket Network Wallet
  * A picture of what it would look like as an extension can be found on the tempcheck.

title: Building in
body: Building in the Bear? Building Product? of course. Building an audience? probably not. Targeting a crypto audience is currently \~30-40% cheaper. Anecdotally 6 months ago a quality CT follower \~$1 now \~$.65.

title: How to build your community using NFTs?
body:
As the NFT economy continues to grow, so does the technology behind it and how brands and businesses utilize it to build their communities. Figuring out what an NFT community is and how to build one successfully can be difficult. With blogs, social media, online community-building, engagement events and so much more; the tactics to build NFT communities are evolving. In this article, you would learn how to build an NFT community and common pitfalls to avoid while building an NFT community.Â 

## What is an NFT community?Â 

The NFT crypto community refers to a group of people that actively collect, trade, sell, and engage in conversations about Non-Fungible Tokens or NFTs. A creator is one who mints his or her digital artwork or NFT project on an NFT marketplace. A collector is one who buys and holds the NFT to participate in the community. NFT communities can be spread across a variety of social platforms including Twitter, Telegram, Reddit, Discord, and the Bitcoin Talk forum.

## Why do you need an NFT community?

NFT communities are adapting to become more visible to new collectors. Creators are utilizing communities to learn from each other, engage and share ideas. Engaging within the community would help creators build more credibility and gain a loyal fan base. In a nutshell, a strong NFT community can help set the foundations for a lucrative NFT sale and creates awareness about the creatorsâ€™ artwork. In addition to this, building a strong NFT community from the get-go ensures a lot of money is not spent on marketing NFT projects.

NFTs build community ecosystems. They provide brands and individual artists with a great way to connect with people with similar interests. Brands and artists can use NFTs to usher in a new era of audience involvement by offering exclusive access, promoting participation through gamification, and becoming a significant part of a consumer's digital identity.Â 

A good NFT community is a key metric for investing in NFTs. An NFT project can be recreated, but the community around that project cannot be. The larger the community, the more word-of-mouth it attracts, and this eventually helps to market the project to more potential buyers.

## How to build an NFT community?

Here are some tips to keep in mind while building your NFT community.

### Identify your audience

This is the first question to ask yourself before building a community, who is the target audience. Depending on the demography of the target audience, the content and the channel of interaction would vary.

### Set a visionÂ 

It is crucial to have a clear roadmap for the NFT community youâ€™re building. Are you an NFT community that shares NFT information/news? How about a community that exchanges NFT art with each other? Are you a community that is into music NFTs? Or are you an NFT gaming community? It always helps to identify what your community hopes to achieve.

### Choose your channelsÂ 

Persistent communication is the key to building a well-knit community. There are various social media and apps to help you out.Â 

* Telegram - It can be used for brief messages, announcements, and quick interactions.
* Reddit -Â  It provides you with a channel to expose your NFT projectâ€™s ideas, raise awareness, and request feedback. Setting up a subreddit for your project gives you a space for longer discussions and allows you to reach a wider audience.
* Twitter - It is the best platform to promote NFT news, Airdrops, community events, and giveaways. It can also be used for making announcements.
* Discord - It can be used to communicate with followers and keep all information about your NFT project in one place. You can host live events, and Q&As, and upload screenshots and videos of progress in your NFT project.
* Instagram - It can be used for raising awareness about your NFT art, posting reels about your NFT project, and hosting giveaways.

### Value authenticity and trust

Don't let your rapid progress overwhelm you as you continue to create your community. Set a goal not to stray from your vision because it is the reason your community exists in the first place. Have an audience-first approach.

### Keep your audience engaged and excited

Events play a key role in building a good NFT community. Hold Ask Me Anything sessions, giveaways, competitions, bounties, and Airdrops. Reward early members, and award badges or NFTs to early adapters.

### Embrace collaborations

Collaborate with artists, musicians, and influencers. Partnerships with notable brands will help your community gain visibility and grow. Embrace collaborations that add value to your community and its members.

### Instill loyalty using proof of attendance protocol

Using the proof of attendance protocol during NFT launches can be useful in incentivizing users who join the community from the get-go, are active, and add value. This creates loyalty among the members of the community.

### Ensure your website is prepared for high-traffic

Website crashes are no fun. During launches, it is highly likely that your website would experience high traffic. It is hence essential to stay equipped for a situation like this. In case, if individuals are affected because of crashes, then have compensation prepared.

## What makes a good NFT community?

Each community has its unique set of qualities, but what defines a truly strong one, and how to create a successful NFT community yourself? It is important to realize a strong NFT community is not just about trading and transactions. A good community must focus on providing value and growth to the community members.

Some of the key features to consider to build a good NFT community:

* Consistent Engagement
* Sharing similar interests
* Persistent communication
* Awareness about the crypto space
* NFT community benefits
* Extra collectibles and assets
* Digital possession of NFTs
* Sole ownership of assets
* Trustworthiness

## These are some great NFT communities to look out for

### 1. Vee Friends

![The Vee Friends Community by Gary Vaynerchuk](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/gzqE6XLX11xWaSFuchb1u.png?height=583&width=950)

### 2. Bored Ape Yacht Club

![The BAYC NFT Community](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eqYq0eC43sZU6MphrLhaU.png?height=488&width=1428)

### 3. Loot

![The Loot Project Community](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GalQBxi5nB_Iy0ilPnbhj.png?height=585&width=1875)

### 4. World of Women

![The World of Women NFT Community](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/f04_Yk1rZqmSKw1V_zEPe.png?height=803&width=1133)

### 5. Bandit

![The Bandits Club NFT Community](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nkQdzbGjFj6S4aUMujWtl.png?height=730&width=1859)

## What to not do when creating an NFT community?

It is easy to get carried away when building an NFT community. Here are some common pitfalls to avoid when creating an NFT community.

1. **Paying for engagement**
   Some NFT founders frequently employ a group of people to engage in false community engagement on their channels, asking questions about the products and consistently praising the team in order to give the impression that the community is active. This does not reap any benefits over time. So always focus on organic engagement.
2. **Generic or Unrealistic Goals**
   Roadmaps and goals act as a guide to the communityâ€™s direction. It is impractical to create extremely generic roadmaps or unrealistic goals. This raises a red flag among the community members. So be truthful and do not over-promise.
3. **DIY-ing**
   In the initial stages of the NFT community, you might have to wear a lot of caps. But as the community grows, it is ideal to hire people to moderate and coordinate the activities of the community.
4. **Ignoring Feedback from the community**
   In order to ensure that your community moves forward, you need to pay heed to the feedback from members and implement the relevant ones. This creates a sense of belonging among the members of the community.
5. **Incentivizing too much**
   Whitelisting may be necessary to reward your active members, but you must be mindful that this isn't the primary factor driving their participation in your community. You should support natural interactions where participants voluntarily contribute in a meaningful way to the project's expansion and uphold a dynamic environment in the community 
 

## Conclusion

Building an NFT community isnâ€™t going to happen overnight, and the process isnâ€™t a cakewalk. But it is essential to build an engaged and active community around your NFTs as it can be a great way to drive the adoption and usage of your NFTs. It can also help you create a loyal following of fans and supporters who can help spread the word about your project.

title: Project Journey in MoonDAO
body:
With the increasing adoption of Web3 technology, companies with traditional top-down pyramid structures are gradually evolving into new types of organizational relationships with bottom-up DAOs. This new type of organizational relationship can greatly improve the subjective initiative of individuals, tap the multi-faceted potential of individuals, further liberate productivity and accelerate our communication efficiency.To fully understand how this relationship is built the bottom-up governance of such DAO as MoonDAO needs to be examinedÂ in contrast to how traditional LLCs operate.

MoonDAO is a consortium of space enthusiasts, crypto investors and DAO builders that was formed by Pablo Moncada and Kori Rogers in November 2021. Its primary objective is to decentralize access to space by funding space travel and exploration in a Web3 way.

## Advantages of DAOs (ie MOONDAO)

**It offers incentives**

Holding $Mooney offers such incentives as participatory governance and compensation. A unit of $Mooney equals a bundle of voting power which is required in the governance of MoonDAO, and it is the most preferred mode of payment by core contributors in its various work streams. Essentially, it can either be purchased on listing exchanges directly or recieved as vested compensation over a period of time. Most importantly, holding $Mooney directly implies that one has a stake in the affairs of MoonDAO by voting on proposals and it increases the incentive to transition from working in traditional companies to joining a DAOâ€™s work force.

$Mooney is projected to exponentially increase in value as the decentralization agenda of MoonDAO progresses which is a far greater incentive to hold than to sell it off at the current market value. There is proof that the vast majority of investors who bought $Mooney since it began trading on JuiceBox are still holding and while their tokens may not have increased significantly they have a strong conviction about its future. Finally, incentivizing MoonDAOâ€™s core contributors with only a promise of future tokens was pretty easy because its value proposition gives it an edge over others through its potential to solve some of the major challenges in the space industry; it is also the result of MoonDAOâ€™s retroactive compensation plan which was executed after three months of enormous undertaking which cost nearly $1 million in salaries (ie compensation) and reimbursements.

**It stimulates passion**

The applicability of blockchain technology through DAOs can reduce the credit cost. Traditional enterprises have cumbersome processes to ensure the compliance of economic transactions, whereas DAOs, based on blockchain technology and web3 tools, liberates project members from the process and puts more energy into the value creation and value output of project construction.

By peer-to-peer working mode, people can have a great freedom to work, whether in space and time. It arouses the interest of team members in the project, and stimulates their initiative of work and study.

**It promotes democratic mode of decision making**

Of course, decentralization means a wider public participation in governance and discussion of matters. To a certain extent, it will bring about inefficiency. MoonDAO has effectively explored how to balance efficiency and democracy.

We have realized over time that having the whole community weigh in on small decisions has become a recurring bottleneck for MoonDAO. In an effort to accelerate the execution speed of our DAO, we have developed a method for allowing the DAO to trust certain individuals to work on properly scoped-out, non-perpetual, goal-based projects such that they have their own access to funds via a multi-signature wallet.

The proposal also includes rules and guidelines for how to work in a transparent and auditable way, how compensation will work for those teams, and how the community can voice their comments or concerns with the project team.

We believe that this step forward will increase the speed at which the DAO can operate, with the added benefit of increasing decentralization, autonomy and organization!

## Process

Therefore, we set up the MoonDAO Project. MoonDAO Projects are non-perpetual, goal-based teams that are voted to act as trusted executors on behalf of the DAO to complete a mission. Projects can apply for a budget from the community to complete their goals, and once the mission is completed the team is disbanded.

### Phase 1: Preparation

1\. Selection of Project Direction

According to the demand in MoonDAO of ourselves or othersâ€™ feedback, first find the sore point, and choose the direction of the project.

2\. Talent Aggregation

We can gather like-minded members in discord, and use our network resources in reality to invite friends together. Then form a team with a variety of talents and comprehensive abilities.

3\. Proposal Writing

The democracy and relative efficiency of DAO is based on Google's online documentations, online sheets and on-chain voting. After Team leads work out all materials like the timeline, OKRs and budgets of the project, it is posted in discord and all members of the community can read and give opinions. And finally summarize to form the final version of the plan file, reducing the cost of consensus

4\. Two Votes

There are two votes open to the whole community.

a. The proposal is active for a maximum of 7 days for it to reach a threshold of 30 Discord thumbs up from our DAO members.

b. After meeting the threshold, the proposal will be included in that batchâ€™s weekly snapshot for approval by the DAO and the DAO can vote on the snapshot for it to be passed.

### Phase 2: Â  Implementation

1\. Guiding teams

As the team steward, there are two core aspects to consider:

a)Â Positioning and task assignment of team members. After planning the roles required for the project, community members are naturally a talent pool for every project.

b) Formulate rules and regulations of penalties and rewards to staff rules to follow and create a good management system.

2\. Control the Progress

Follow the schedule of timelines and planning matters on the proposal. And by using discord and google doc, the team can easily make meeting agenda, organize a meeting and report timely project progress to the whole community.

3\. Public informed

Projects work transparently in the DAO such that anyone in the DAO can audit the work that is being done, and can weigh in if they have questions, comments, or concerns. They will also receive access to the Notion where they can archive documents, meeting notes, etcâ€¦

4\. Compensation

a) Do project stewards receive any compensation?

Project stewards will be compensated with a $5,000 monthly salary paid in Dai. This salary is only meant to cover living expenses, and is only a portion of the full compensation that may come from Coordinape while theyâ€™re leading a project.

Steward pay will be consistent for each project, with a maximum of two leaders per project. If someone is already a leader in a project, they may lead a second project, but they would not receive pay from multiple projects.

b) How do other project members get paid?

Compensation for members on a project will not be included in the budget. Rather, every pay period the DAO will vote for the proportion of $MOONEY tokens that are distributed to each project. Then, inside each project a Coordinape will be created to pay everyone that has helped in that project.

## Thoughts & Experiences

Here are some experiences some project leaders and participants have and summarize in the process of the project and if you want to join in this journey, you go ahead with the things above!

**Hayrul Music NFT Projectï¼Richardï¼š**

After proposing the idea of building KOLs and Hayrul Music NFTs, it quickly gained support from $Mooney holders in the community and quickly formed a team.

In less than a week, singer Hayrul completed the creation of the song, and the community spontaneously donated to help the production and distribution of the song, and the community's connections quickly contacted the Tencent music platform, and the release was successful. Such a rapid organization of resources to execute projects is an advantage that traditional industries do not have, as Team lead saves a lot of communication and coordination costs, and can focus on the development of ideas.

My personal experience about web3 projects construction especially for NFT projects is that enough attention, exposure and visibility are important. In order to bring enough traffic, I conceived to focus on cultivating community members, becoming KOLs, helping the project to continue to drain, and being able to exert efforts in the early, middle and late stages of the entire project, with continuous people, stories, communication and narrative.

**Writing Projectï¼CarolWï¼š**

I'm editor-in-chief from the writers guild, and I've been involved in both guild and project. In MoonDAO, the guild and project are both independent and related. Each guild also needs to do a project to apply for a project to apply for a salary incentive or funding reimbursement.

The Mirror project is just initiated by the internal discussion of the risks guild in discord - we strongly felt the urgency of the mirror sub-domain name, and it was necessary to build the mirror as a communication base for the project to promote the brand and project ideas. So after planning the general process, writers who were willing to write articles were openly recruited to participate in the creation. Write proposals (including time planning, task division, etc.) and submit them to the community for voting. After the project proposal is adopted, it will be carried out step by step according to the time point, and the division of labor will be cooperated.

Compared to the working mode of traditional companies, I have new experience in the process of organizing and participating in DAO projects.

First of all, it is small and efficient. The project setting time period is no more than one month, and even long-term projects need to be applied for in stages. On the one hand, this is conducive to urging the project to set short-term goals, carry out efficiently in a limited time, and complete small tasks in a short period of time, rather than the traditional company's project settings for a long time, resulting in staff procrastination; on the other hand, MoonDAO's support for small projects is conducive to rapidly promoting the development of matters and efficiently promoting DAO to maturity step by step.

Then there is enough openness and transparency. The initiation of the project, the mid-term work discussion, the phase meeting are fully open and transparent in discord, and the details of the project expenditures for which the funds have been requested will be submitted for review. This greatly reflects the intention of the DAO to decentralize.

***(Author: CarolW Richard; Editor-in-chief: CarolW)***

title: An Ode to Summer
body:
Bless this house, oh Lord, we cry.

Please keep it cool in mid-July.

Bless the walls where **[termites](http://dict.qsbdc.com/termites)**[1](http://www.enread.com/humors/dumbpeople/116437.html#_w_1) dine,

while ants and roaches march in time.

Â 

Bless our yard where spiders pass

fire ant castles in the grass.

Bless the garage, a home to please

carpenter **[beetles](http://dict.qsbdc.com/beetles)**[2](http://www.enread.com/humors/dumbpeople/116437.html#_w_2), ticks and **[fleas](http://dict.qsbdc.com/fleas)**[3](http://www.enread.com/humors/dumbpeople/116437.html#_w_3).

Â 

Bless the love **[bugs](http://dict.qsbdc.com/bugs)**[4](http://www.enread.com/humors/dumbpeople/116437.html#_w_4), two by two,

the **[gnats](http://dict.qsbdc.com/gnats)**[5](http://www.enread.com/humors/dumbpeople/116437.html#_w_5) and mosquitoes that feed on you.

Millions of creatures that fly or crawl,

in Texas, Lord, you've put them all!!

Â 

But this is home, and here we'll stay,

So thank you Lord, for insect spray.

title: An Ode to Summer
body:
Bless this house, oh Lord, we cry.

Please keep it cool in mid-July.

Bless the walls where **[termites](http://dict.qsbdc.com/termites)**[1](http://www.enread.com/humors/dumbpeople/116437.html#_w_1) dine,

while ants and roaches march in time.

Â 

Bless our yard where spiders pass

fire ant castles in the grass.

Bless the garage, a home to please

carpenter **[beetles](http://dict.qsbdc.com/beetles)**[2](http://www.enread.com/humors/dumbpeople/116437.html#_w_2), ticks and **[fleas](http://dict.qsbdc.com/fleas)**[3](http://www.enread.com/humors/dumbpeople/116437.html#_w_3).

Â 

Bless the love **[bugs](http://dict.qsbdc.com/bugs)**[4](http://www.enread.com/humors/dumbpeople/116437.html#_w_4), two by two,

the **[gnats](http://dict.qsbdc.com/gnats)**[5](http://www.enread.com/humors/dumbpeople/116437.html#_w_5) and mosquitoes that feed on you.

Millions of creatures that fly or crawl,

in Texas, Lord, you've put them all!!

Â 

But this is home, and here we'll stay,

So thank you Lord, for insect spray.

é‚£ä¹ˆ Evmos æ˜¯å¦‚ä½•è¿›è¡Œå¾…å®šçŠ¶æ€æŸ¥è¯¢çš„å‘¢ï¼ŸEvmos å°†è¿›è¡ŒæŸ¥è¯¢ï¼Œä»¥è§£é‡ŠèŠ‚ç‚¹äº¤æ˜“å†…å­˜æ± ä¸­å­˜åœ¨çš„ä»»ä½•æœªç¡®è®¤äº¤æ˜“ã€‚è¿›è¡Œçš„ç­‰å¾…çŠ¶æ€æŸ¥è¯¢å°†å¯ä»¥è‡ªä¸»é€‰æ‹©æŸ¥è¯¢å°†åœ¨ç›®æ ‡èŠ‚ç‚¹çš„å†…å­˜æ± ä¸Šè¿›è¡Œã€‚å› æ­¤ï¼Œå¯¹äºä¸¤ä¸ªä¸åŒèŠ‚ç‚¹çš„ç›¸åŒæŸ¥è¯¢ï¼Œç­‰å¾…çŠ¶æ€å°†ä¸åŒã€‚è¿™ä¸ªå¯¹äºæ‰€æœ‰ tendermint çš„ Cosmos é“¾çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹éƒ½æ˜¯å¦‚æ­¤, å› æ­¤å’Œ Eth çš„ global mempool å®Œå…¨ä¸ä¸€æ ·ã€‚è¿™æ„å‘³ç€æ¯ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹çœ‹åˆ°çš„ TX é¡ºåºéƒ½æ˜¯ä¾æ® P2P gossip æ”¶åˆ°çš„é¡ºåºæ˜¾ç¤ºï¼Œ å› æ­¤ä¸€ä¸ªå¤„äºäºšæ´²çš„ node çœ‹åˆ°çš„ tx å’Œé¡ºåºä¼šå’Œç¾å›½çš„ä¸€ä¸ªå®Œå…¨ä¸ä¸€æ ·ã€‚ä¸€ä¸ª broadcast äºäºšæ´²çš„ tx ä¼šåœ¨è‡³å°‘ 300ms åæ‰ä¼šé€šè¿‡ p2p gossip åƒé‡Œå¹ºå¹ºçš„ä¼ åˆ°ç¾å›½çš„ nodeã€‚æ¯ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹æ¥å—ä¿¡æ¯ä¸ä¸€æ ·ï¼Œæ ¹æ®æ—¶é—´å·®å¼‚ï¼Œæ ¹æ®ä¸åŒçš„åœ°ç†ä½ç½®ä¼šäº§ç”Ÿå¸¦å®½å»¶è¿Ÿé—®é¢˜ã€‚
